Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 July 2021
Review - Body: The iPhone 12 Mini‚Äôs build quality, speed and task handling are the same to my untrained eye as the Max‚Äôs. Indeed, the oddest observation I can make is the zero difference I have experienced reading, texting and photo editing compared to the larger iPhone.Reading social media feeds is no different at all. Text on the iPhone 12 Mini doesn‚Äôt seem smaller in day to day use. Perhaps it might do in a side-by-side comparison.Using the iPhone 12 Mini is a joy. It is bliss when leaving home with a phone that slips into a pocket and stays unnoticed.The Mini is light even when compared to my wife‚Äôs iPhone 11 Pro. I can‚Äôt believe how much heavier my wife‚Äôs Pro phone feels.So far, so good.The iPhone 12 Mini works with MagSafe accessories and is capable of fast charging, so at least I haven‚Äôt wasted the expense of those items (Apple MagSafe Wallet and Charger).Unlike the iPhone 12 Pro Max, the Mini is comfortable to hold, easier to type on and works.But, there‚Äôs always a but.There are only two issues that weaken my long-term commitment to the concept of an iPhone Mini-sized phone:No telephoto lens - I miss some photo opportunities.A weaker battery - Always start the day on a full charge to avoid getting caught out.I don't regret buying the Mini, especially when Amazon cut the price by ¬£100. But in an ideal world, I'd prefer an iPhone Mini Pro.

Product Title: Sonos One (Gen2) The powerful smart speaker with built in voice control (Black)
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great quality speakers
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 January 2023
Review - Body: These speakers are great quality. I use this in the kitchen/diner for music when cooking, cleaning and having guests over. Its never too quiet, the sound can fill the whole room with good quality and have more to give.There is integration to Amazon Alexa and to Goggle Assistant. I found the Google integration was completely useless and did not work at all, that was my preferred option so had to go with Alexa in the end. That being said, the Alex integration works perfect with no issues. Although i do find the voice control sometimes does not work top tier. I'm not bothered about that, but you may of course be.For me the sound is what i judge this speaker on. SONOS also provide the SONOS home app on your phone. This is actually pretty good and kind of works like spotify. Essentially a free streaming service for music with ads unless you buy premium. I dont tend to use it but did give it a go and liked all the curated playlists and radio stations they have made.

Product Title: Sonos One (Gen2) The powerful smart speaker with built in voice control (Black)
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I got one... two... then three...
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 June 2020
Review - Body: I started with just one of these speakers. First thoughts its easy to set up. App is reliable, makes it super easy to play music.I then brought a second to create a stereo pair... that was the WOW factor. It completely changes the listening experience. The audio sounds so much richer. I was shocked on how much it changed the music I was playing and now there's two we havent actually gone above 50% volume ü§≠ because its so loud.We was so impressed we brought a third for the bedroom. Now I can play music everywhere while I'm wondering around and doing the house work!My issues with these speakers... all three of them in fact.ALEXA just seems to have bugs on Sonos.1st. If your broadband drops, well Alexa will refuse to reconnect, she just constantly says something along the lines "i'm struggling to connect at the moment, please check your Internet connection". The weird thing is the Sonos side works fine and reconnects fine after a drop. E.g. I can play music via the app. You are forced to restart all the speaker everytime the internet drops to rekick in the Alexa integration.2nd. Some features are limited compared to Amazons own devices. E.g. Alexa cant phone people. You can't connect any multirooms with Amazons own alexa devices.3rd. Alexa just randomly does not play music when you ask her to. "Alexa, play music from Harry's Spotify account" and then she just stops... Check the Alexa app... and she heard me perfectly and understood (you can see your speech against text on how alexa understood what you asked).Although we have now got to a point where we just don't use Alexa, which isn't a big deal for us but might be for others. All said, Generally Sonos is a fantastic eco system and Sonos Ones don't fall short from what you should expect from the brand.

Product Title: Sonos One (Gen2) The powerful smart speaker with built in voice control (Black)
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Fantastic little speaker, allows use of Alexa without need for Echo or Dot devices.
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 January 2020
Review - Body: Having taken the plunge to install some smart lights and sockets, when I read about this product it appeared that the Alexa voice component was for use with audio features however it also allows us to use voice control of anything that "she" is linked to. Once we had added the Sonos skill to Alexa we did not need the Echo in our kitchen any longer and were able to re-purpose it in another room.The unit itself is very smart, small, satin black plastic in appearance with the metal grill around the middle outer surface. The sound from such a small device is however very clear, crisp and has a surprisingly rich bass to it for the size. At higher volumes it is not as good as the larger Play5 unit but common sense dictates that at the end of the day.Touch controls on the top surface are very easy to use, regardless of how dry, damp or greasy your fingers may be but it would be advisable to only use dry and clean hands to prevent muck being deposited into the ring of very small holes that constitute aperture for the microphone array.When using voice control the speaker can be trained with the Alexa app to better understand a particular user's voice however the generic "out the box" settings work perfectly for all my family as none of us have strong regional dialects. I cannot speak for anyone from Newcastle or Glasgow but when I was reading the reviews on this unit on some hifi websites they did state that for such accents the training would be beneficial so that it does not keep moaning about not understanding voice commands. Just be aware that if you put the unit in a corner and run it at anything about about 6/10 on the volume scale then it is likely it will not respond to voice at all as the system will be making so much noise that it may not accurately hear your commands.

Review - Title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    damage / dirt
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 February 2023
Review - Body: I've bought 3 pre-owned from Amazon over the last few years.  This is the first phone that has visible damage to the corner.  The screen and back are free of scratches.The phone also had dirt build up from the previous user's case.  The dirt is around the charging port and the button to turn the sound on/off.I understand the damage to the top corner, it is second hand so can't expect no damage at all.  But I am disappointed that they couldn't have cleaned the dirt off the phone.  I'm wondering whether it's refurbished at all or they just reset the phone and box it for shipping?The other disappointing thing is, I thought it would come with a USB-C charger like all the IPhone 12's do and it didn't.  It's just a regular charging cable, so now I will have to purchase one.I'm still to test it out fully, as will need to check the call quality etc.  Overall the phone looks good, I'm just really disappointed that it wasn't cleaned properly.

Product Title: Apple iPhone 11 (64GB) - White
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    If you're swapping from Android and have never had an iPhone, this is the best one for you!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 July 2022
Review - Body: So, I had just brought this phone a good two months ago and I have never been so pleased with a phone before. I had come from a Samsung S10e and if any of you knew that phone, you would know it is a small and very compact phone. My battery life on the Samsung was really bad, so I had decided to get an iPhone 11. Happy to say that I don't regret buying it.I had got the initial phone for ¬£480 ish as I brought the 128gb version, since I needed the storage. I have barely used half of the storage too, which is good. The battery is actually good, it goes down gradually as the hours pass, but sometimes I notice that if I keep certain apps like Spotify opened up for a long time, the battery tends to go down faster, but that's probably because I have Spotify on 24/7. However, on a normal day, the battery basically lasts for most of the day.I had a hard time trying to adjust to the new phone and its' new functions, but I had quickly gotten used to it as I used it more and more. Obviously this is common knowledge but I don't like that Apple had gotten rid of the earphone jack. That annoyed me. But the sound is amazing on this phone.The camera is pretty decent too, it feels like I have a professional camera in my phone. The camera has many functions to suit different people's needs when it comes to having a camera in their phone. I have taken some really nice shots with my phone, and my friends could not believe that it came from my iPhone.Not going to lie, I used to be a Samsung fanboy, so I would always put Apple down for their phones and say that Samsung was better. However, that is now the contrary. I am absolutely pleased with the phone, and I know everyone hypes up iPhones, and yeah, to an extent, it shouldn't be hyped up that much, but, in my experience, this is a rock solid phone and I recommend buying it if you can't afford the more newer phones, as it essentially has all of the functions the newer phones have. Additionally, the iPhone 11 will be updated for more years, so that's even more of a reason to buy this phone.

Product Title: Apple iPhone SE 2nd Gen, 64GB, White (Renewed)
Review - Title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Bought as Excellent but Battery Health 78% Returned
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 December 2022
Review - Body: Ordered for a Christmas present, read through the Amazon renew guarantee of all items inspected and graded and all grades have a battery capacity of greater than 80% so I ordered the excellent condition 64GB version and the seller was Plunc Tech, I even read the reviews on the seller and nothing was sticking out from the feedback.Item arrived in plain packaging with a charger and charging lead and sim tool, it was well packaged, took the phone out screen had a crusty blob of what looked like food, but came off, no dents or scratches on the casing and only a few hairline scratches on the screen, charged it up, set it up and went to battery health and was gutted to see the batter capacity was only 78% to say I was peed off is an understatement.Contacted Amazon and they were very apologetic and asked if I wanted to contact the seller first, I agreed and the seller said all the usual about how all phones are checked and fully refurbished before being sent out, however this wasn‚Äôt my experience. They sent me a Royal Mail return label just as they was going on strike so posted on Tuesday and wasn‚Äôt delivered until the Monday, I was hoping for a replacement or at least a new battery, and when I contacted them today asking for the options, the reply was we‚Äôve refunded you, now the earliest I can get a replacement is Christmas Eve I would have rather had this phone‚Äôs battery replaced even if it didn‚Äôt arrive in time for Christmas so I new that I‚Äôd have a nice phone with great battery.Now I‚Äôve reordered from a different company and im now playing Russian roulette hoping the battery is decent and not a duff, Apple considers batteries of less than 80% as needing replacement.The Amazon renewed guarantee is great though and customer service are really helpful and explained that anything your not happy with within 12 months you can return or replace, it was just unfortunate that this happened at Christmas timeUpdate: Second iphone arrived this time only 81% battery, as this is supposed to be a phone in excellent condition I‚Äôm not that happy as this battery will need replacing within a year, so another returned iPhone, im not being picky I just want something that will last at least 12 months without any issues and the battery is the main issue, phones described as excellent, good or acceptable should be based on the health of the battery, if I ordered a phone in an acceptable condition then I‚Äôd be ok with this, but paying a premium for excellent condition, this just isn‚Äôt good enough

Review - Body: So I discovered Casekoo on YouTube, started using a black translucent one on my iPhone 14 pro max, after trying 3 other brands(spigen was one of them), sent them all back for various reasons, then got the Casekoo case and I liked it so much I kept it on the phone for 6months until I upgraded to my 15 pro max, I had to have another for my new phone, so I went with the blue one to match my blue 15 pro max, it really does compliment the phone well.What I like most about the case is the fact that it‚Äôs very good value for money, was ¬£16.99 at the time of writing this review, which I think is very good, as the case feels premium and well made, really soft and comfortable to hold, and I‚Äôve noticed with this version they‚Äôve added a slightly textured surface to the sides, to aid grip, the sides were just smooth on the 14 pro max version I bought 6/7 months ago, so that‚Äôs a nice change too. Obviously all the ports are perfectly cut out, and buttons very clicky and responsive. The raised camera bump is generous too, to protect the camera lens when laying the phone down. For me it strikes a good balance of being drop protective, but not too bulky, and without adding too much weight to the phone.Overall I can highly recommended casekoo

Review - Body: I recently acquired an iPhone 15, and my priority was to find a case that could offer superior protection without compromising the phone's sleek design. The CASEKOO Armor Shockproof for iPhone 15 proved to be the perfect choice, striking a balance between robust defense and a slim profile.First and foremost, the matte finish gives it a classy and premium look. The black color adds a touch of sophistication, and it's resistant to fingerprints, so my phone always looks pristine. The slim design doesn't add unnecessary bulk to my iPhone 15, which is something I truly appreciate.The standout feature of this case is its military-grade protection. It's built to withstand a 10-foot drop, providing me with unparalleled peace of mind. The corners have extra reinforcement, which is where most impact occurs during drops. This case can take a hit and protect my iPhone 15 flawlessly.Moreover, the non-slip texture is fantastic. It ensures a secure grip in my hand, preventing accidental drops. The precise cutouts for ports and buttons make it a breeze to access all the features of my iPhone 15. The tactile buttons feel responsive and easy to use.The raised edges around the camera and screen provide an added layer of protection, preventing scratches and dings when I place my phone face-down. This attention to detail shows that CASEKOO has thought of everything.Installation was a breeze, and the slim design makes it easy to slide my iPhone 15 in and out of my pocket without any hassle.In conclusion, the CASEKOO Armor Shockproof for iPhone 15 Case is the ideal combination of style and protection. It offers military-grade defense against drops and accidents while maintaining a sleek and elegant appearance. If you're looking for a case that can handle the toughest situations without sacrificing aesthetics, this is the one. I highly recommend it to anyone with an iPhone 15.

Review - Title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Dissatisfied, comfort issues
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 October 2023
Review - Body: I am dissatisfied with this purchase. Whilst the case seems to be made of decent quality materials, it does not fit iPhone 15 pro well.My biggest complaint is that the phone sits too deep in the case so the case edges stick out too far which makes corner-swipe gestures a lot more difficult to perform. When the phone is held in one hand such swiping becomes even harder.My second complaint is that the new iPhone 15 series side button is barely reachable. My fingers are relatively thin, but I can press the button only using my index finger nail (with some effort!)The third complaint is that the magnetic lock on the side may become an issue because it is quite hard and stick out far enough to cause discomfort, particularly when the phone is held in one hand.As I said in the beginning of this review, I like the materials and design of the case, but the fit issues are annoying.Hopefully, this review will be seen and considered by the manufacturer with a view on improving this product.

    ¬†I was looking for a smartphone, but I have to say that they are quite expensive. I was very pleased to find this one which I find comparable to a name brand phone and even better and someways at a fraction of the cost. This smartphone has a lot of memory up to 256 GB of ROM and 14 GB of RAM. I like that you can also expand it up to 1 TB if you use a TF card. This is a rugged phone. It feels like it has a case on it already because it is very thick and it is IP 68 waterproof as well. It also has dustproof and drop-proof resistance to it to you. This has a 5,000 MAH battery so I can get up to 16 hours of constant use before it needs to be recharged. It even has a cool built-in light in the back with different functions like SOS and adjustable brightness. This phone comes with some built-in apps and it‚Äôs very easy to navigate. I like how user-friendly it is as well, and once I hooked up my information in the play store, I can download anything I wanted. Love it!

Product Title: Blackview BV9300 Rugged Smartphone 2023,15080mAh, 21GB+256GB, 100 Lumen Super Bright Flashlight Outdoor Rugged Phone, 6.7''120Hz FHD+ Display, 50MP+32MP Camera, 4G Dual SIM Waterproof Android 12, NFC
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Decent size screen, quick operations
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 October 2023
Review - Body: My first impression is that its a substantial phoneOn switching on for the first time one is prompted to select a language . It's easy to change from the default English USA to English UKYou then insert your SIM card(s) or you can skip this and connect to your wi-fi this may take a few minutes to get the phone readyOn completion you are offered the option to copy apps and data from another device. this can copy apps, photos, contacts google accounts etcThis can be done wirelessly if you don't have a double ended cable. You open the Google app on your old device and tap set up new deviceAfter a minute or two one can then choose what to copyAllow a few minutes for thisYou can  choose  between Gestural or button navigation. It's easy to switch back later if you change your mindA search engine can be selected then a PIN, the fingerprint sensor takes a few minutes to set up but it's progress can easily be followednext you can unlock your face this can be set to work with eyes openNext are Vision SettingsDisplay size and text where one can easily adjust the font and display size by means of a sliderthen set the magnification option this enables one to quickly zoom in and out on screen using two fingersThen there is a screen reader for those with visual impairment it reads the screen out loud with the powerful speaker on the rear. To force a restart hold the power button for 10 seconds or soI have dealt with Blackview previously and can confirm they are always to help if necessary

Product Title: Blackview BV9300 Rugged Smartphone 2023,15080mAh, 21GB+256GB, 100 Lumen Super Bright Flashlight Outdoor Rugged Phone, 6.7''120Hz FHD+ Display, 50MP+32MP Camera, 4G Dual SIM Waterproof Android 12, NFC
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Excellent phone
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 August 2023
Review - Body: I received this on the 13 Aug but only started transferring over three days ago. Yes it's a tank of a phone but for the price, specs & storage, I can't complain. A week's worth of researching, I don't regret buying it,Yes it's heavy but using it for 4 hours on a draining app only used 6% battery, the screen is a fantastic size at 6.70 inch and brilliant colour.I can't afford the slimline ranges at over ¬£1000, just can't/won't justify the purchase, not even the other budget Chinese phones.The UI is friendly after a few niggles as no instructions came with it.Huge 256gb storage & can add 1TB SD card for extra storage 12gb RAM.It's a winner for me.Holding the phone will be my gym workout.No extras come with it, the case is rugged enough to withstand an accident of not Battery life is awesome, a whole day used 10% plus with 33w charging it's full on less than 10mins.Camera leaves much to be desired but got over that using G Cam.Stereo speakers‚úÖ6.70 inch screen ‚úÖBattery life üåüüåüüåüüåüüåüUI mostly customisable ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠êThis is one serious phone but not for aesthetics.I'm totally in love with this BV9300.Goodbye samsung, Huawei and the rest.Update 23 Aug, sim tray broke, how in the living hell did they design a stupid hinge of all the blasted things, for a sim tray? I'm livid.UPDATE :There's a problem, phone crashed and display greyscale, support informed a motherboard problem.If there's s problem why is this not communicated?

    ¬†It's worth saying firstly that these phones are bigger than the average phone so as long as you don't mind a bit of extra bulk on your phone then this device is absolutely brilliant.The BV9300 from Blackview has an amazing spec, very large battery and is housed in a rugged designed case that gives it top end drop protection, dust and waterproof protection. The screen is a 6.7" 120Hz FHD display, it has a 50MP rear camera and 32MP selfie camera, it takes two 4G sim cards and it runs Android 12 which means it has compatibility with almost any application.Spec is great with 21GB of RAM and 256GB of storage. You can expand the storage up to 1TB with a TF card if required, although I doubt I'll need to do so. The battery is 15080mAh which is more than triple the last iPhone capacity and lasts for a long time.These phones are as good as any top end smart phone and a fraction of the price, the only downside is they are bigger, heavier and chunkier.

    ¬†The Blackview BV9300 is designed to handle the harshest environments with its robust construction and military-grade durability. Underneath its tough exterior lies a powerful device that doesn't compromise on performance. Equipped with a high-capacity battery, the BV9300 keeps up with your demanding schedule, providing long-lasting power to get you through the day. Its octa-core processor, combined up to 21GB of expandable RAM provides smooth multitasking and seamless performance and the large 256GB of storage is fantastic. The 6.7-inch Full HD+ display offers crisp and vibrant visuals, making your photos, videos, and games come to life. The 50 megapixel camera captures your adventures with superb clarity, especially during the day. Its fingerprint scanner and facial recognition technology offer convenient and secure unlocking options, keeping your data protected while providing quick access to your device

Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 October 2023
Review - Body: this is my first EVER smartphone (bought because the world has adopted a system that says, if you want to use the net for ANY transaction, you HAVE to have a mobile for verification purposes!! - insane as far as im concerned, but there you go)so i tried to find the best of all features with the best price (quite a search i can tell you)and so far there are more negatives than positives, first of which is the massive LACK of guidance with this thing - literally nothing but the very basic manual to show you the main features and thats it, and for a proper noob like ME, thats an issue!then theres things like facial and thumbprint verification and as far as i can tell, they just arent there (it might be me being stupid or something, but i simply cannot find them on the device)BUT, for a TINY little thing that can sit in your pocket, get access to the net, emails, take stunning photos, allow passcodes and verification purposes for the PRICE it IS, brand NEW, it does kinda work!

Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars

Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 January 2023
Review - Body: Condition:Bought the 13 Max Pro 1TB renewed in Excellent Condition from PixelDirect. Unfortunately there was a small scratch on the screen, and there are plenty of marks on the body. This goes counter to what Excellent Condition should be! I was hoping for much better. Battery was 90% which isn't too bad.Size:It's big but not so big as to make it unusable most of the time. I've quickly gotten used to it from my 6S. It has some heft to it and feels solid.Usage:It's fast and nippy loading apps and moving between them, and the screen is great to look at. The camera take some getting used to, but it's producing good photos so far. It does, however, take ages to charge. The seller enclosed a 10W charger - not great as this will take around six hours for the phone to charge, if I remember correctly. Ok if you charge it overnight. The phone itself can draw around 27W, so buy yourself a 30W charger to get the most out of its fast charge ability and hit 100% in 1.5 hours.

    Seems a good phone so far, but the delivery‚Ä¶
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 January 2023
Review - Body: I, like everyone else considering this product, was a bit wary of ordering a renewed phone instead of a new one, without seeing it first anyway. However, upon arrival & first look the phone is in impeccable condition! Everything seems to work as it should and the screen, edges, cameras etc are all free from any signs of use. I do however have two criticisms. The first, is that the battery health is only at 83%. My old iPhone is better than that at around 91/92! Still, it‚Äôs a second hand phone and it works. It‚Äôs really not the end of the world. It does it‚Äôs job and seems fine.My main issue was the delivery. When I heard that the phone was being sent through Evri my heart sank. I‚Äôve lost so many parcels with them lately, this is actually the first parcel I‚Äôve ever had arrive in one piece from them. The parcel was lost, then turned up again, then lost again, delayed, and finally arrived a week after it was due and then thrown over my 6ft garden fence. Luckily however, the phone is in one piece. I would just urge the seller to reconsider who they are using to send these devices.I would gladly buy another device from this company when the time comes, but not if Evri are taking anything to do with it.

There were some small scuffs on the stainless steel band, but they were not too noticeable and did not cause any discomfort during use. I was impressed with the overall condition of the phone, indicating that the previous owner took good care of it. Upon testing all of its features, I found that they were all in good working order. However, I was a bit disappointed with the battery life. The battery health was only 84%, which is lower than I expected. Upon further investigation, I found that the phone had lost over 800mAh of its battery capacity and had gone through over 700 charge cycles. Given these factors, I would have preferred if the battery was replaced. Despite this, I am happy with the functioning of all the other features of the phone.

Product Title: Apple iPhone XR 64GB Blue (Renewed)
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Virtually as new iPhone at a great price
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 July 2021
Review - Body: I already have one of these which I bought second hand last year and cost about ¬£285. These are a real bangs for bucks modern iPhone that can still be bought new from Apple for ¬£500. This one from Amazon renewed was for my Father-in-Law. At the same price and only 6 months after buying my own this is a great deal considering the guarantee. As long as you‚Äôre not too bothered about the lack of original box and accessories there‚Äôs a lot to like. For a start the battery health was showing 97% which is great. My own XR has 89% and still easily gets through a day. The back glass and front screen were perfect and completely unmarked. I did find a couple of very minor scuffs on the mid frame. I queried these with the seller because the description says the phone should look ‚Äòas new‚Äô from 30 cm, which I thought was over egging it. I requested a part refund to the pre price increase cost of ¬£256 which was agreed. The marks were super minor so I would say at half the new cost for an XR this is exceptional valueEverything works properly on this iPhone and the only set up issue was that the seller had already done a base set up and had incorrectly set the country to USA not UK. Consequently when we tried to set up Siri we were offered US voices and the weather app tried to give us local weather stateside. Once we started from scratch and reset all settings selecting UK as the country everything went smoothly and the set up was completed FaceID working correctly iCloud signed in etc. So all in all a good buy and the cheapest way to get a relatively up to date virtually as new iPhone with some peace of mind

Product Title: Apple iPhone 11 Pro, 256GB, Gold (Renewed)
Review - Title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Poor quality control, fake display, poor battery
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 March 2022
Review - Body: The product came in absolute pristine conditions, as advertised. No problems in that regard. But the very moment I turned on the phone, I realised that the screen is very pixelated and shows colour fringing around the letters (purple borders on black text on a white background) and I immediately knew something was wrong. As soon as I finish setting up the phone, I get a notification from the phone itself that the screen is not original and it may cause issues. I wouldn't recommend paying this much for an iPhone Pro, renowned for its display quality, if it comes with a non-Apple, low quality display!UPDATE: I decided to order a replacement. This time the iPhone they sent wouldn't even turn on. Whereas the customer team seemed to do everything they could to help, I guess it all comes down to the very poor quality control team, which doesn't even check whether the phone they're sending off even switches on.UPDATE2: I ordered a THIRD replacement and as expected, the third one came with the same issues. The battery was at 80% (1% away from needing to be replaced) and the screen was a low resolution, non-original Apple screen, same as the first phone I returned. The team really doesn't seem to care to send genuine Apple parts with the iPhone, so I would seriously recommend against buying this phone. You don't buy an iPhone for the Apple logo, but for the quality of the components inside! If they're not genuine (especially something as important as the screen), then it's not worth your money.DO NOT BUY

Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    The Future of Laptops Arrives - Apple's 2022 MacBook Air!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 October 2023
Review - Body: The 2022 Apple MacBook Air, powered by the M2 chip, is an absolute game-changer in the world of laptops. The 13.6-inch Liquid Retina display is breathtaking, offering crisp, vivid visuals. With 8GB of RAM and a 256GB drive, it's the perfect blend of performance and storage for my needs. The MacBook Air's sleek design, lightweight build, and silent operation are impressive. It's blazing-fast and versatile, making it a dream for both work and play. Product Title: Apple 2022 MacBook Air laptop with M2 chip: 13.6-inch Liquid Retina display, 8GB RAM, 256GB SSD storage, backlit keyboard, 1080p FaceTime HD camera. Works with iPhone and iPad; Silver
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I love this laptop, mostly
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 September 2023
Review - Body: Apple have stiffed us again on memory and storage. Get the entry level Mac or sell all your organs and your first born to get a more ‚ÄòFuture Proofed‚Äô one. I need my organs and my first born was having none of it, so I got the entry level one. Software has taken up most of the internal storage, so external SSD drives are an essential. I hate Apples cloud service, it always wants to be uploading or downloading a different file to the one I am trying to use, so I save a lot to external drives. I‚Äôm not a fan of track pads, never have been it‚Äôs not just a snipe at Apple, so I have a Magic Mouse 2 as well. That combo works great for me. Okay, complaining out of the way. The build quality is insane. The battery life is amazing. The onboard sound is really quite good. The screen looks great, but likes to dim itself from time to time, probably a setting I haven‚Äôt got right yet. The keyboard feels nice and positive, with a subtle backlight that helps a lot. Finger print login speeds things up nicely. Close the lid and it goes into standby, which is useful. Magnetic charging port stops it from being dragged off the desk by mistake, it simply disconnects from the Mac instead of dragging it to it‚Äôs doom. I‚Äôve had no issues with overheating, it‚Äôs cooled through the case without fans. The lack of fans means that it is silent in operation, important stuff like watching shows at four in the morning with your earbuds, while a loved one snores obliviously on beside you. Like I said, I love this Mac I just wish it had more storage and ram at this price point.
Review - Format: Size Name: 256GBColour Name: Space GreyVerified Purchase

Product Title: Apple 2022 MacBook Air laptop with M2 chip: 13.6-inch Liquid Retina display, 8GB RAM, 256GB SSD storage, backlit keyboard, 1080p FaceTime HD camera. Works with iPhone and iPad; Silver
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Truly lightweight and portable - ideal if you have issues with wonky hands
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 September 2022
Review - Body: I am very pleased with this purchase. I usually have to sit up at a desk and use my iMac but, with a few health problems, this isn't always possible. I am a Logic Pro X hobbyist and, if I'm stuck in bed, or on the sofa, feeling a bit meh, it's not always possible to bash a few tracks together when inspiration strikes.I installed it last night, and it runs like a dream. I'm not a proper producer so I don't want to try to sell it as great for the real musicians out there, it works fast enough for me which was the important thing.It is very light to carry, which is important to me as I have somewhat wonky hands. It also has a lovely magnetic charger so it can't get yanked off a table by a passing cat and I know they are planning it because, well, cats.The keyboard is great! I was expecting to be fumbling a bit moving from one keyboard to another. Usually I'm mashing letters and my touch-typing goes completely awry, but this was seemless between an Apple Magic fullsize keyboard and this gorgeous gold (starlight colour if we're being proper) Macbook Air.I've not checked the battery life yet but if I can edit this later I will add that in.The sound is not awesome because it's a laptop and they are never awesome. I expect it's fine for a YouTube video but not so much for my intended usage. However, I plugged in a set of headphones and I now have no complaints about the audio quality being piped into those in the most glorious manner. As I generally prefer headphones than external sound, I am not bothered but others might want to take this on board. You are not going to manage a party using this as your soundsystem unless you plug something into the headphone socket or have bluetooth speakers etc.Personally I think the screen/colours/clarity is perfectly adequate, but I'm getting on in years , eyesight not great, and I don't edit video or images. I can't review how well that would work as I'm really not looking at much on it beyond YouTube or Logic.It feels speedy. It boots very quickly and there's no delay in opening apps. Yet. I suspect if I make a large piece of music it may struggle slightly opening that up to edit. I say this because my 32GB Ram iMac struggles a bit sometimes and this is only 8GB. I am not a heavy user with a million tabs open and several apps at once so your mileage may (will) vary.It was faster to order this from Amazon than it would have been from the official Apple site. I recall being very impatient waiting for what seemed like forever for my iMac to arrive.All in all, I am delighted with this. It's made my life easier already. It is super fast for what it's got under the bonnet. Sure, there are better Macbooks out there - depending on what you want to do with them -  but, for the cost, and what I need it for, it's perfect for my needs.

Product Title: Apple 2022 MacBook Air laptop with M2 chip: 13.6-inch Liquid Retina display, 8GB RAM, 256GB SSD storage, backlit keyboard, 1080p FaceTime HD camera. Works with iPhone and iPad; Silver
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Lightweight and fast
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 November 2022
Review - Body: I‚Äôve always owned an iPhone and iPad for general day to day computing, but for anything major or needing to be sat down for any period, I‚Äôve always used a windows computer. I used to build them with the help of my son in law and repair them, but there comes a time when I couldn‚Äôt keep switching from iOS to windows and visa versa, and my trusty windows laptop finally failed and it was time to upgrade to a Mac. It wasn‚Äôt too difficult to get to grips with the different operating system, seeing as it‚Äôs very similar to iOS.The whole machine is very well laid out, the keys are responsive and light, but the track pad has taken a while to get used to, and it‚Äôs totally different to a normal windows laptop. Ie mainly the hard push click rather than a light tap, two or three fingers to move the page up and down and shift between windows. Mind you there are plenty of online instructions on how to use it, along with a ‚Äòhow to use‚Äô program on the laptop to study at your own pace.What also struck me, was how everything opens up so fast, apps, programs, web pages etc, as soon as you click on them it‚Äôs there, no computer thinking about it, no pinwheels, even films load and play straight away, even from an outside source like a flash drive.The magnetic charging lead if a novel idea, and extremely useful if you forget that you have it on charge and just walk away with it, I use these magnetic chargers a lot with my iPhone and iPad, saves a fortune in cables.The laptop is very lightweight and I‚Äôm finding that I‚Äôm using it more than my iPad now, as it fits neatly in your hand or on a tray while sitting down in your armchair.The only feature I do miss is the lack of a dvd drive, but as I already had a external drive, I found with the help of a USB C hub I‚Äôve been able to bring it back into use, when required, along with a Bluetooth mouse, card reader etc.The colours are crisp and clear with the 1080p liquid retina screen, sound is the same on the 4 speaker system, when playing films and music.Battery life is huge, up to 18 hours, obviously it does depend on what your doing. Charging is super fast, as long as you use a fast charger and cable.First thing I did though, was get a clear protective case, to protect that lovely blue case, as I carry the laptop around with me in a backpack, and don‚Äôt want to scratch it.All in all I‚Äôm very pleased with the Mac, yes it does take some getting use to, if you come over from a windows based machine, but it‚Äôs worth it in the end.

Product Title: Apple MacBook Air 13" (Late 2018) - Core i5 1.6GHz, 8GB RAM, 128GB SSD - Space Grey (Renewed)
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Difficult to factory reset
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 March 2023
Review - Body: When I first opened the macbook I was greeted with the macos ventura set up screen where I made my account as I was scrolling through the settings there was another account on the macbook called "test" whom observed admin controls, I tried to remove this account and I couldn't the screen would turn blank every time I tried so then I tried to factory reset the entire macbook and start it off fresh. I tried factory resetting and that didn't work I kept ending up with an error, I was worried about returning the macbook, thinking about the time I had wasted and what a waste this was. I kept on trying though and ended up resetting the macbook by erasing the hard disk and reinstalling macos ventura, the screen would also randomly shut off and never turn back on until I manually powered it on - this happened atleast 5x. But, finally the macbook started and I was once again greeted with the macos ventura setup so I continued and immediately went to check the users, and the "test" account was finally gone. What a relief.Advantages- Bright retina display- Good, loud speakers on both sides of the macbook air- No problems with any of the keys (so far)- Touch ID works perfectly- Managed to log into my Apple ID (I couldn't log in at the setup screen but after I set up the macbook I could in setting preferences)- Larger force touchpad- 2560 x 1600 resolution- NO FAN SOUNDS!! (even after using the macbook for long periods of time (e.g. 5 hrs))Disadvantages- Dirt under many of the keys due to the previous owner- American keyboard although I live in England- Hard to change any of the settings e.g. resetting, removing users- Small screen 13" (could however be improved by purchasing the macbook pro model)- Slow wi-fi speed (all my other devices were at high speeds, except this macbook air but I fixed it by changing the DNS)- Battery runs out quicker than expected (it would most likely last me around 7-8 hours rather than 12-13 like advertised)- No genuine apple charge includedOverall, I would recommend this macbook air to any other students, like myself, or people who are simply doing light work on the macbook. E.g. editing online documents, reviewing flashcards, watching videos and films, checking e-mails. Would not recommend for editing intense (50+ min) videos due to the i5 processor. It is quite light and small so it is very portable - however I have read and watched many other reviews and after 3-4 months of using the macbook many people have experienced issues with the butterfly keyboard so be aware (dust gets caught under the keyboards due to how close the keys are to the base)

Product Title: Apple 2023 MacBook Pro laptop M2 Pro chip with 12‚Äëcore CPU and 19‚Äëcore GPU: 16.2-inch Liquid Retina XDR display, 16GB Unified Memory, 512GB SSD storage. Works with iPhone/iPad; Silver
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Best laptop I‚Äôve ever owned!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 May 2023
Review - Body: Bought on Amazon monthly payments last week (pay in 5), best laptop I‚Äôve ever owned. Period. The battery life lasted me from Sunday until late on Wednesday without needing a recharge! Then when it does need a recharge? It‚Äôs back to full again in about 1.5 hours! The laptop is able to handle whatever I throw at it and even in the current heatwave I‚Äôve not heard the fans kick in once or witnessed any signs of thermal throttling. It‚Äôs a power horse and a very silent one! But then what do you expect for over ¬£3000? The very best! And that‚Äôs what you get. It‚Äôs much faster, much quieter, and much more efficient than any windows machine I have ever owned. And the battery life? It‚Äôs absolutely phenomenal! I went with the 16 inch M2 Max variant with 1TB SSD and 32GB unified memory. If you wish to choose the slightly lower specced M2 Pro variant though you will most likely have a very similar experience to myself. The Max shines in more graphically intensive tasks (due to double the GPU cores) so if you‚Äôre looking to play games or work with heavy graphics get the M2 Max. For anything else don‚Äôt feel bad about saving yourself some cash, just get the M2 Pro. My old laptop barely managed 3-4 hours on juice and the fans used to kick in within minutes of booting up so you can appreciate this feels like a massive upgrade! Also, before I forget, the 16 inch MacBook Pro screen is like an OLED TV on a laptop, it‚Äôs super bright (when viewing HDR), the blacks are true black, and the colours pop. 6 speakers produce incredible sound, the best I‚Äôve heard on a laptop! Highly recommend if you‚Äôre able to purchase on instalments like I did. I‚Äôm glad I caved and bought it last week because the option to pay by instalments has mysteriously vanished for me this week. Money very well spent. Probably won‚Äôt need to upgrade for a fair few years! Yes they‚Äôll keep releasing new macs every year that are way overspecced for the current generation of laptops but that‚Äôs the Apple way! Future-proofed right off the bat. Realistically? This machine will still be fast in 2-3 years. Possibly more. 32GB unified memory with Apple is somewhat on par with a 64GB windows machine. Not to mention that even if, on the rare or even improbable event that you run out of memory, it will just use SWAP on the super fast SSD. And a 1TB SSD has a pretty long lifespan compared to the baseline 256gb Mac models. Just remember to pick the right spec for you because you can‚Äôt change your mind afterwards.

Product Title: Apple 2023 MacBook Pro laptop M2 Pro chip with 12‚Äëcore CPU and 19‚Äëcore GPU: 16.2-inch Liquid Retina XDR display, 16GB Unified Memory, 512GB SSD storage. Works with iPhone/iPad; Silver
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Marvellous machine but why no charging light?
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 July 2023
Review - Body: I won't recite technical details of this laptop as they can be found in many descriptions and reviews.Normally, I am a Win 11 user but there is something about the vibrancy of the 16.2" screen of the Macbook Pro M2 that lured me to buy this. Somehow, it looks more polished.  It's a different way of working from Windows but it does not take long to adjust to clicking on the top left of a window rather than the right.This is a very fast computer. It boots up in seconds from just opening the lid and has really good Wi-Fi connectivity. It is a heavy laptop compared with the Mac Air and smaller screen Mac Pros, which you would expect. For me, it is not a laptop I'll be carrying around much. I do have an Air for that. I am fortunate enough to have a few laptops which I use for writing and web surfing. For ease of use and sheer power, I would say that the HP Pavilion  17"  is very similar although the Pavilion has a touch screen as well. Overall, the Mac 16.2" is very impressive and the larger screen is worth the upgrade if you can afford it but there is a slight trade off in portability.What did surprise me was the surround sound quality of the speakers. They are really excellent.  Apple have manged to make a 3d sound effect like surround sound that really works in films  but particularly in certain Apple Music songs too.One thing that bugs me though, why is there no external charging light? You have to turn on the machine to see whether it is fully charged or not.

Product Title: Apple 2023 MacBook Pro laptop M2 Pro chip with 12‚Äëcore CPU and 19‚Äëcore GPU: 16.2-inch Liquid Retina XDR display, 16GB Unified Memory, 512GB SSD storage. Works with iPhone/iPad; Silver
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Mobile Powerhouse
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 March 2023
Review - Body: I moved across from Windows to Mac OS when the 13‚Äù M1 MacBook Pro was released a couple of years ago and immediately began to love the Mac way of doing things and the insane production value and battery power of Apple silicon MacBooks.The one complaint I have was just that the machine itself was quite small in terms of screen real estate, and working on spreadsheets or multiple documents while on the move felt crowded.I decided to go for the 16‚Äù to give me the extra screen space and I‚Äôm so glad I did!  I can‚Äôt say that I notice the extra CPU cores since I‚Äôm mostly just browsing the web, producing documents or other office related tasks, but the machine itself is beautiful and the extra display space is game changing.The upgraded webcam, extra ports, better screen brightness and 120hz refresh rate are amazing additions too. But for me the battery life is the most noticeable upgrade. I used it on battery for a full working day and it was still just over 50%. The M1 was pretty good in this regard, but this is next level.The only downside is that the extra size/weight just make it that tiny bit less portable and easy to whip out or move between offices. In a backpack it‚Äôs not noticeable, but just carrying it from kitchen to lounge etc feels like more of a task than before, or using it on your lap on the train.  All are doable, but it‚Äôs no longer a one-hand easy movement.That, for me, is a very minor pain point on an otherwise beautiful device that will last me for years to come.Nice work Apple.

    ¬†**(I bought a laptop case prior to receiving this item, it does not come with the purchase)**I was extremely hesitant to purchase a refurbished MacBook, let alone one that wasn't directly from Apple. But I'm so glad I took the leap of faith because I'm absolutely thrilled with what I received. On day 1 of receiving the MacBook and inspecting it, it came in at 67% battery charge and couldn't wait to dive in and examine every detail.I was pleasantly surprised with what I found. The laptop was visibly very clean (100% no dents nor scratches ). The cycle count was at a reasonable 54, the condition was normal, and the maximum capacity battery life was at an impressive 100%. The keyboard was fully functional, and the speaker, Bluetooth, and WIFI were all working without any issues. I did notice that the Disk Utility SMART status was not supported, and I haven't had a chance to test the firmware password, but I'm not too worried about it.It was clear that the previous owner took excellent care of it, and I was excited to make it my own.I tested all the ports with a flash drive, external mouse, and dock, and everything was working seamlessly. The only downside was that the charger didn't seem to work. But I plan on reaching out to the seller to request a replacement.Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a quality refurbished MacBook. Don't be hesitant like I was - take the plunge, and you won't be disappointed!---UPDATE---I wanted to update my previous review to share that I had a great experience with the seller when it came to the charger issue. I reached out to them, and they promptly exchanged the faulty charger for a good one within a day. I was so relieved and appreciative that they were willing to rectify the situation.Now that I've been using the refurbished MacBook for a week, I can confidently say that it's still functioning perfectly. I've put it through its paces with hours of movie-watching, programming and coding, school work, web browsing, and basic PC use. Even with all of that usage, the battery still performs optimally and can last for a little over a day without needing to be charged.Overall, I couldn't be happier with my purchase. This refurbished MacBook is a great value for the money, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a high-quality laptop that won't break the bank.

Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    A Game-Changer: Apple's 2022 MacBook Pro with M2 Chip
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 October 2023
Review - Body: I've had the privilege of using the Apple 2022 MacBook Pro with the M2 chip for quite some time now, and I'm thrilled to share my experience. This laptop is, without a doubt, a masterpiece in the world of computing.From the moment I powered it on, I was blown away. Like all Apple products, it just works flawlessly. The seamless integration of hardware and software is second to none, and the M2 chip takes performance to a whole new level. The MacBook Pro handles everything I throw at it with ease, making multitasking a breeze.One of the most impressive features has to be the battery life. It's nothing short of amazing. I can take this laptop anywhere, from coffee shops to long flights, and not once have I had to worry about charging it. This level of freedom and mobility is a game-changer for my productivity.The laptop's sleek and lightweight design is a joy to carry, and it feels incredibly premium. The stunning Retina display is a feast for the eyes, providing vibrant colors and sharp clarity, making it perfect for work and entertainment alike. The Magic Keyboard is comfortable and responsive, and the improved speakers deliver exceptional sound quality.What truly sets the 2022 MacBook Pro apart is its performance. It's fast, incredibly fast. Whether I'm editing videos, running complex software, or just browsing the web, it handles it all effortlessly. The M2 chip is a powerhouse that ensures you're never left waiting for your laptop to catch up with you.In addition to its performance, the MacBook Pro offers an extensive range of connectivity options, including Thunderbolt ports and MagSafe charging, which is a welcome return. The versatility is excellent, and it adapts to all your needs.To sum it up, if you're in the market for a laptop that redefines what's possible, the Apple 2022 MacBook Pro with the M2 chip is the way to go. It's fast, reliable, and versatile, making it a perfect fit for both work and leisure. It's an investment in productivity and enjoyment that I wholeheartedly recommend to anyone seeking a top-tier laptop.In conclusion, I'm incredibly satisfied with my purchase, and this MacBook Pro has exceeded all my expectations. It's a masterpiece of engineering, and it's easy to see why Apple has earned its stellar reputation. Don't hesitate ‚Äì invest in the Apple 2022 MacBook Pro with M2 chip and elevate your computing experience.

    ¬†**(I bought a laptop case prior to receiving this item, it does not come with the purchase)**I was extremely hesitant to purchase a refurbished MacBook, let alone one that wasn't directly from Apple. But I'm so glad I took the leap of faith because I'm absolutely thrilled with what I received. On day 1 of receiving the MacBook and inspecting it, it came in at 67% battery charge and couldn't wait to dive in and examine every detail.I was pleasantly surprised with what I found. The laptop was visibly very clean (100% no dents nor scratches ). The cycle count was at a reasonable 54, the condition was normal, and the maximum capacity battery life was at an impressive 100%. The keyboard was fully functional, and the speaker, Bluetooth, and WIFI were all working without any issues. I did notice that the Disk Utility SMART status was not supported, and I haven't had a chance to test the firmware password, but I'm not too worried about it.It was clear that the previous owner took excellent care of it, and I was excited to make it my own.I tested all the ports with a flash drive, external mouse, and dock, and everything was working seamlessly. The only downside was that the charger didn't seem to work. But I plan on reaching out to the seller to request a replacement.Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a quality refurbished MacBook. Don't be hesitant like I was - take the plunge, and you won't be disappointed!---UPDATE---I wanted to update my previous review to share that I had a great experience with the seller when it came to the charger issue. I reached out to them, and they promptly exchanged the faulty charger for a good one within a day. I was so relieved and appreciative that they were willing to rectify the situation.Now that I've been using the refurbished MacBook for a week, I can confidently say that it's still functioning perfectly. I've put it through its paces with hours of movie-watching, programming and coding, school work, web browsing, and basic PC use. Even with all of that usage, the battery still performs optimally and can last for a little over a day without needing to be charged.Overall, I couldn't be happier with my purchase. This refurbished MacBook is a great value for the money, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a high-quality laptop that won't break the bank.

    ¬†**(I bought a laptop case prior to receiving this item, it does not come with the purchase)**I was extremely hesitant to purchase a refurbished MacBook, let alone one that wasn't directly from Apple. But I'm so glad I took the leap of faith because I'm absolutely thrilled with what I received. On day 1 of receiving the MacBook and inspecting it, it came in at 67% battery charge and couldn't wait to dive in and examine every detail.I was pleasantly surprised with what I found. The laptop was visibly very clean (100% no dents nor scratches ). The cycle count was at a reasonable 54, the condition was normal, and the maximum capacity battery life was at an impressive 100%. The keyboard was fully functional, and the speaker, Bluetooth, and WIFI were all working without any issues. I did notice that the Disk Utility SMART status was not supported, and I haven't had a chance to test the firmware password, but I'm not too worried about it.It was clear that the previous owner took excellent care of it, and I was excited to make it my own.I tested all the ports with a flash drive, external mouse, and dock, and everything was working seamlessly. The only downside was that the charger didn't seem to work. But I plan on reaching out to the seller to request a replacement.Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a quality refurbished MacBook. Don't be hesitant like I was - take the plunge, and you won't be disappointed!---UPDATE---I wanted to update my previous review to share that I had a great experience with the seller when it came to the charger issue. I reached out to them, and they promptly exchanged the faulty charger for a good one within a day. I was so relieved and appreciative that they were willing to rectify the situation.Now that I've been using the refurbished MacBook for a week, I can confidently say that it's still functioning perfectly. I've put it through its paces with hours of movie-watching, programming and coding, school work, web browsing, and basic PC use. Even with all of that usage, the battery still performs optimally and can last for a little over a day without needing to be charged.Overall, I couldn't be happier with my purchase. This refurbished MacBook is a great value for the money, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a high-quality laptop that won't break the bank.

    ¬†**(I bought a laptop case prior to receiving this item, it does not come with the purchase)**I was extremely hesitant to purchase a refurbished MacBook, let alone one that wasn't directly from Apple. But I'm so glad I took the leap of faith because I'm absolutely thrilled with what I received. On day 1 of receiving the MacBook and inspecting it, it came in at 67% battery charge and couldn't wait to dive in and examine every detail.I was pleasantly surprised with what I found. The laptop was visibly very clean (100% no dents nor scratches ). The cycle count was at a reasonable 54, the condition was normal, and the maximum capacity battery life was at an impressive 100%. The keyboard was fully functional, and the speaker, Bluetooth, and WIFI were all working without any issues. I did notice that the Disk Utility SMART status was not supported, and I haven't had a chance to test the firmware password, but I'm not too worried about it.It was clear that the previous owner took excellent care of it, and I was excited to make it my own.I tested all the ports with a flash drive, external mouse, and dock, and everything was working seamlessly. The only downside was that the charger didn't seem to work. But I plan on reaching out to the seller to request a replacement.Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a quality refurbished MacBook. Don't be hesitant like I was - take the plunge, and you won't be disappointed!---UPDATE---I wanted to update my previous review to share that I had a great experience with the seller when it came to the charger issue. I reached out to them, and they promptly exchanged the faulty charger for a good one within a day. I was so relieved and appreciative that they were willing to rectify the situation.Now that I've been using the refurbished MacBook for a week, I can confidently say that it's still functioning perfectly. I've put it through its paces with hours of movie-watching, programming and coding, school work, web browsing, and basic PC use. Even with all of that usage, the battery still performs optimally and can last for a little over a day without needing to be charged.Overall, I couldn't be happier with my purchase. This refurbished MacBook is a great value for the money, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a high-quality laptop that won't break the bank.

    The Epitome of iPhone Excellence - Pacific Blue!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 October 2023
Review - Body: The Apple iPhone 12 Pro Max in Pacific Blue is the epitome of iPhone excellence. With 128GB of storage, this device is a powerhouse for all my needs. The Pacific Blue color is not just stunning but also unique. The camera capabilities are unmatched, delivering stunning photos and videos. The A14 Bionic chip ensures top-tier performance, making every task a breeze. If you want the best of what Apple has to offer, the iPhone 12 Pro Max is a perfect choice. It's the ultimate device for those who demand uncompromising quality and style. I couldn't be happier with this purchase!

Product Title: Skullcandy Mod In-Ear Wireless Earbuds, 34 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
Review - Title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Very quiet not for music, had to return. Updated.
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 April 2023
Review - Body: I had to return these due to the sound quality diminishing from a all ready lackluster levelafter 1 month. They would of received 2 stars because the design and battery life were quite well done however, I replaced these with the skullcandy indy anc and it blows the mods out of the water with the benefit of the skullcandy design. So in summary 1 star as they pale in comparsion to other models in this price range from this brand.Good chargeUsb c type charge portgood fit in earwill stay in unless you shake your head side to side aggressively.Earbuds buttons usefulUseful appNow the sound. I would only use for podcasts but even then they aren't great. Any slight noise around you will make the sound very hard to hear and often impossible. Even in a quiet environment sound is low. It's very disappointing from skullcandy who up till this point have been very reliable. I also checked with another person to make sure I wasn't just deaf and they confirmed how quiet they are, although when you can hear them sound is clear at least
Included components: Cable, User Guide, Charging Case, Ear Gels (S, M, L), True Wireless Earbuds

Product Title: Movo iVlogger Vlogging Kit for iPhone - Lightning Compatible Video Vlog Kit - Accessories: Phone Tripod, Phone Mount, LED Light and Shotgun Microphone - for YouTube Starter Kit or iPhone Vlogging Kit
Review - Title: If you want to shoot in portrait‚Ä¶
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 October 2023
Review - Body: If you want to shoot in portrait you should know that with the design of this the light ends up on one side of you instead of directly in front resulting in a shadowy background. Plus when in portrait, since the weight shifts to one side, it tends to tip over when used as a stand - making you have to get it just right every time just so it won‚Äôt fall over and also making it a pain in the ____ to push a button on the screen and keep your shot.  The light charges fairly quick and is bright. The microphone is good at close range but could be better at more than 1 meter. Hand held use isn‚Äôt good for steady video but it‚Äôs a sufficient selfie stick type of option. Not worth the price if that‚Äôs all you use it for tho.

Product Title: Movo iVlogger Vlogging Kit for iPhone - Lightning Compatible Video Vlog Kit - Accessories: Phone Tripod, Phone Mount, LED Light and Shotgun Microphone - for YouTube Starter Kit or iPhone Vlogging Kit
Review - Title: Very good for beginners, but just one caveat
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 June 2020
Review - Body: First off, I would like to say this kit is actually really really good for the money. I was looking for something that was fairly inexpensive, so I could put together a few videos for my workplace as well as instructional videos for some friends with my iPhone. This does that in spades, a very good carrying case, nothing feels cheap or flimsy in it. Comes with a good microphone and decent light. It was easy to set up for the most part, however, just one thing that I wish came with the kit was at least a small set of instructions to explain certain things. Keep in mind, I'm coming from a 100% newbie into this type of stuff, so, I didn't really have a good idea how stuff works when it came to this. So, here's just a few things I found out:1. The base that mounts the light and microphone doesn't have a cut out in the case, it's in the mesh pocket.2. The light, while decent, doesn't have a ton of run time, so keep that in mind.3. The microphone when plugged in, at least for my iphone 11, didn't have any indication that it was working. The only way I knew is I downloaded a decibel meter to test it. With an iphone 11 (I have no idea about android devices, or other iphone series) the microphone is just plug and play and it works.4. The microphone has two settings on it a bent line and a straight line, which in no way shape or form is described what they do, after some research I can tell you that the the bent line cuts out low frequency, which means that the sound of air conditioner, microwave, ceiling fan, etc. is muted. The straight line means that it will pick up these noises. So bent line reduces ambient noise, straight line picks up all noise.Hopefully this review helps some people out, this is a great product in my opinion, just needs a manual to help explain things to 100% newbies like me when it comes to vlogging and video recording.

Review - Body: This was a replacement for a Lenovo who's UI was the source of much frustration. The Samsung runs Android as you'd expect. The only negative thing I can say is the screen brightness seems below par, but I can live with that.What's been realy poor is Amazon's delivery. Signed up for prime, was supposed to be next day delivery but not calls or no emails to say there was an issue. Logged in to account when package failed to appear only to fin it had been collected by courier but then returned. Update said delivery late, if not received in 3 days time check account again. I appreciate things can go wrong, but when I cancelled Prime, Amazon charged me for Prime services that had failed.So I cancelled the ordered and bought my machine from Argos which I collected same day.Your communication needs to be better Amazon.

Product Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab A8 32GB WiFi Android Tablet Grey 2022 Version, 3 Year Manufacturer Warranty
Review - Title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    A disappointment after the A6 that I have still got.
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 September 2023
Review - Body: I thought that the price was reasonable and thought that I was getting a slightly better tablet than the A6. Being Samsung I have not been disappointed with their products, unfortunately that changed with this tablet. The first thing that struck me was the amount of time it took to start up, laborious, then the screen, no matter how I tried to tweak the settings the screen looks washed out, then I looked at some professional write up. It explained that this tablet contained processors and screens that were passed their sell by date, in fact one reviewer was scathing for Samsungs use of such low value components.Then some of the settings seem bizzare, being used to tablet settings over many years this tablet had very limiting functions for their settings, especially the screen. One it is up and running it runs ok but photos are what I do for a hobby and no matter what I try they look below par compaired to my A6. It's still a Samsung and although not running the latest Android version it has been updated by Samsung. The large screen is a bonus but I can't get over how washed out everything seems, I have it now so will make the most of it.
Review - Format: Colour Name: GreyStyle Name: Wi-FiVerified Purchase

Product Title: TECLAST Tablet Android 12 P25T Tablets 10 Inch, 4GB RAM 64GB ROM(TF 1TB), Quad Core 1.8GHz, 1280√ó800 HD IPS, 2.4/5.0GHz WiFi 6+Type C+Bluetooth 5.0+Dual Camere+Face ID+Blue 2023
Review - Title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Does NOT have WideVine L1 (despite advertising it)
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 October 2023
Review - Body: The tablet is ok for the price and seems sturdy.  There is a big issue though.  It advertises WideVine L1 support - necessary to get HD streaming on many apps (e.g. Netflix) but it does not.When streaming netflix the app reports the device as being WideVine L3 compliant with a max resolution of SD (480p).This is substandard for 2023 viewing.A similar issue occurs on YouTube.  You cannot get better than 720p streaming despite setting the app to stream in the highest quality.So to sum up:Pros+ Cheap+ Decent build quality (or so it feels)+ Runs smoothly thanks to 8GB ram and Android 12Cons+ SD viewing on streaming apps despite L1 claims+ Free case that is bundled with it is dire.  It's made of the shiny smooth plastic TPU stuff you get in phone cases and looks cool when you take it out the box.  On use you realise why all other cases have a material that's a bit more course.  When you set the case to sit the tablet up on its side it is so slippy that it just falls apart under its own weight in seconds.  There's no grip for the case to keep in the upright positionFree yes (or was when I bought this tablet on a deal for ¬£80)But also garbageIf SD streaming doesn't bother you - and you can get it for the ¬£80/¬£90 Amazon were offering it on October's prime day it's decentPersonally the streaming is too big a deal-breaker and I'm returning due to false advertisement

Product Title: TECLAST Tablet Android 12 P25T Tablets 10 Inch, 4GB RAM 64GB ROM(TF 1TB), Quad Core 1.8GHz, 1280√ó800 HD IPS, 2.4/5.0GHz WiFi 6+Type C+Bluetooth 5.0+Dual Camere+Face ID+Blue 2023
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Good but with a problem
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 June 2023
Review - Body: The tablet arrived very quickly and it was very quick and easy to set it up and get started. The tablet seems to be quick and responsive and I am generally pleased with it. However, there is an issue that when I try to access Display settings via the Settings App I am just taken straight out of the App and back to the previous screen. I have contacted Teclast and they suggested reloading the firmware via a link that they sent me. I did this although it was not as easy as it should be due to the limited instructions and unclear narrative. However, this did not resolve the issue and Teclast are now advising me to return the tablet to the supplier for maintenance. This does not actually seem to be an option as the only option given by Amazon is for a refund. I found the Teclast support responsive and helpful with the only issue being the time taken to respond which was between 24 and 36 hours each time. Other than the above issue the tablet seems to work ok and all other menu options that I have tried to access so far seem to work.

Product Title: Apple iPad 9.7 (6th Gen) 128GB Wi-Fi - Space Grey (Renewed)
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Very good value for the money
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 July 2023
Review - Body: Bought this to replace a 2yo Android tablet for my 7yo son. The Android tablet had gotten slower and slower (as they always seem to do). My daughter has had this model of ipad for 5 years and it still works like new so I thought I'd try a renewed model as brand new ipads don't come cheap.The device turned up reasonably well packaged and protected in plain box. I was slightly disappointed that an actual charger wasn't included, just a charging cable. Not a huge problem, but ipads generally charge faster with a more powerful charger rather than the standard USB ones.The ipad itself is in very good condition. There are a couple of cosmetic marks on the back of the cover and there is some evidence around the screen bezel that the screen has been removed or replaced at some point (but at least this indicates some level of servicing has been carried out). However these cosmetic imperfections are not a problem as it will be going in a protective case anyway. The screen itself is flawless so no complaints there at all.I've set up the ipad and connected to wifi, it updated automatically to the latest ios version. No issues with usage, everything seems to work as expected, including bluetooth, headphone socket, and fingerprint sensor. Downloaded all the games and apps my son uses, no problems.Haven't used it intensively yet so not sure about the battery life. It charged well enough and on standby has lasted fine so I don't expect any problems, although I would't expect it to perform like new.TBH I would have given 4.5 stars if possible. It was only really the lack of a charger in the box that slightly let it down. Very pleased overall.
Review - Format: Size Name: 32GBColour Name: Spacy GreyVerified Purchase

Product Title: Apple 2022 10.9-inch iPad¬†Air (Wi-Fi, 64GB) - Blue (5th Generation)
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    A Lightbulb moment
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 January 2023
Review - Body: For the last 5 years my previous iPad was stuck in a drawer because I was finding that a combination of iPhone and Mac met my needs. However, I was spending long hours at my desk (which did nothing for posture) or tapping emails and documents on my iPhone (bad for eyesight and plenty of predictive text awkward words for thought or I mis-read) (also bad for RSI).Increasingly I handle home and work tasks on my phone and when I go away I lug my laptop. ‚ÄòLug‚Äô because although it is lightweight, once the fast charger cable and shock protection case are added in it becomes more cumbersome.Three days ago I started something off relaxed on the bed but it was slow and I was squinting so I had to treck to the study. I couldn‚Äôt figure out why I had stopped using the iPad, which by now was gathering dust. It is still okay but I compared screen size and weight with the Air 5th generation and decided that I could justify upgrading.I did look at the larger Pro (12 inch diagonal) but it was seven ounces heavier and larger screen size obviously means larger item of kit. Also the Pro has a lot of elements that are of use for graphic designers and the like and would be wasted in terms of my needs.Here I am. Moved data across to new iPad, synchronised Dropbox and Mail and I have a larger screen (enough to make a difference) and the latest in hardware. I use Mac dictate where suitable - it wasn‚Äôt safe on the iPhone because I failed to spot inaccuracies due to the screen size. I also took the plunge and bought a Magic Keyboard for work such as spreadsheets where I find it very difficult to handle on a tablet.Why a Mac tablet? Because there just seems to be more thought into the ergonomics and operating system. Also because I have been on a Mac desktop for several years and it is very reliable. I have full integration across 4 Mac devices (phone, tablet, laptop and desktop).Is the 5th generation a sea change? It is more an evolution but with a distinct and yet intangible difference. I usually upgrade every third year because year on year the changes are too small to justify the outlay even though I can get something on trade in.Has it changed my life compare with using the five year old one? No but it just has a better feel. Apple generations are iterative and a tweak here and an extra facility there make for a better experience, just as with changing a car after a while. It still only gets you from A to B but the journey is easier.Why buy from Amazon? Saved a few bob but mainly because Amazon is very good on the rare occasion I need to return an item. By contrast, Apple led me a merry dance when they delivered a piece of kit (a fast charger when I couldn‚Äôt find my laptop fast charger) and provided the wrong lead to go with it. All on a recorded call with Apple clearly stating the cable needed.If you are not sure which IPad you want, the Apple site offers a very clear side by side comparison and I read a coupe of technical reviews of the ‚Äòwhich is best for your needs?‚Äô type.Star rating is because I find Apple functionality faultless. It can take a while to convert from Microsoft or other operating systems but I quickly realised how well thought out the Max OS is. The stars are the same as for all Apple kit i have bought except the keyboard that goes with the desktop. I don‚Äôt get that but only because I like a large keyboard.
Review - Format: Colour Name: Space GraySize Name: 256GBStyle Name: WiFiConfiguration: Without AppleCare+Verified Purchase
