Product Title: TOSCiDO Tablet 10 Inch 4G LTE Android 11.0 Octa Core Tablet pc,4GB RAM,64GB ROM,Dual Sim, WiFi,Bluetooth,GPS,Type-c,Gold(Included Tablet Cover)
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Good performance and lots of useful features
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 September 2023
Review - Body: I bought this tablet when I retired and had more time to sit around reading emails, keeping up with social media, and streaming box sets of TV series I never had time to watch. It does all of these admirably, and serves me well.The 10" screen is crisp and clear and has a good viewing angle should you wish to share it with others, for example during a video call. I don't know much about processor types and speeds, but there is enough oomph to power all the apps I use without the screen flickering or pixelating.The onboard storage is pretty reasonable at 64Gb, but if you like to download lots of movies etc you can add a memory card, giving up to 512Gb extra. Some well-known tablets don't offer this facility, and instead sell a range of models with different storage sizes. I find it hard to know my requirements in  advance, so the ability to upgrade as needed is extremely useful and reassuring.Next to the slot for the memory card are two SIM card slots, enabling you to connect to the Internet when there's no WiFi. I tried this out with an inexpensive non-contract SIM and it worked well, first during a car journey, and then in the caravan. Two SIM cards would have doubled the speed, but I found that just one was enough for email, social media and YouTube. There was a little bit of buffering when streaming TV, but it was within acceptable limits.Accessing the slots for the memory and SIM cards was a bit fiddly; you have to prise off a plastic strip that doesn't feel like it wants to be removed, and I was frightened I might break the case. But it did come off safely in the end, and it certainly won't fall off accidentally!The operating system is Android 11 GO. I wasn't familiar with Android, but setup was easy and guided, so I was soon up and running and connected to WiFi. It took me a little while to get used to the slight differences to my mobile phone, but my 7-year-old grandson was happy to teach me! All the usual apps are available in the Play Store. I use Google password manager on my phone and PC, so most of the apps installed and logged in automatically.After a while doing simple things and getting used to it, I started to investigate Android versions of apps I normally use on my PC with its big screen and extra CPU power. I was surprised to find they worked well, and I now use the tablet to view and edit music, rather than carrying around sheets of paper. From simply using the tablet for TV, YouTube, music and so on, I'm now using it for much more, thanks to its convenient size, weight, and CPU power.The tablet comes with free accessories to make this easy: a case, a screen protector, and an on-the-go (OTG) cable. I hadn't seen an OTG cable before but I quickly discovered its usefulness. You plug one end into the tablet's USB (type C) port, and the other end is a standard USB socket, so that you can attach all sorts of useful USB devices just as you would on a PC. I've attached memory sticks, and a keyboard and mouse. The keyboard and mouse was useful, as I can type much faster than I can poke an on-screen keyboard with a finger. Not all USB devices are automatically supported, though, so beware. When you plug a USB device into a PC, the PC will search for the appropriate drivers; these can be found online and are often only available for Windows, Linux, and MacOS. This will no doubt change over time, but for now only the simpler devices are supported.The tablet comes equipped with WiFi and Bluetooth, and also has a 3.5mm headphone output, which I like because it enables me to connect the tablet into my sound system to provide backing tracks.I like the design of the tablet. In 'landscape' mode, which is best for most things, the volume buttons and on/off switch are easily accessible on the right-hand side, and the USB charging cable plugs in at the top. My main criticism is that the speakers - which are quite good quality - are on the bottom edge. I often use a padded support to hold the tablet, so I don't have to hold it, and the speakers can get muffled by the padded ledge it sits on. Most times I'm using bluetooth headphones, so it doesn't matter, but placing the speakers on the top edge would have better.The user-facing camera is on the top edge, ideal for video calls. At 6MP this camera is fine for this application; network lag is the usual problem so a higher resolution would potentially cause more problems. A 13MP camera is on the other side. I haven't really used this a lot, as a tablet isn't the easiest way of taking a picture. I have used it on occasions for taking a picture of a document, or something small that I needed to enlarge to a size that suited my eyes, and it works very well. But when I go for a walk, I take my phone rather than my tablet, simply because of the more convenient size.To conclude: I like this tablet. It does everything I want, and probably more. It's robust and has been dropped, kicked, and used as a coffee coaster without any ill-effect. The screen is good, the free accessories are actually useful, and the ability to expand the storage, and to connect to the Internet via a SIM card sets it apart. It's incredibly good value for the price and you can buy with assurance, knowing that what you buy today can be expanded to meet future needs.

Product Title: Apple 2021 iPad (10.2-inch, Wi-Fi, 256GB) - Space Grey (Renewed)
Review - Title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Apple iPad 256GB, Great Product, Dreadful Seller experience
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 June 2023
Review - Body: I have absolutely no problem with Apple products, I love them, the issue here is the seller. (EXPRESS GADGETS).I am a long time Prime member of Amazon and love it, however his is the first time I have purchased a used electrical item and the experience is not good so far.The iPad arrived as ordered with my Prime membership, not in the original box and not overly protected by the seller but not a real issue there as it was a used item (refurbished).The product was as described, used refurbished in A1 condition and I was happy, however, within the first two weeks a fault started appearing intermittently on the screen, this showed as a series of fine vertical lines running horizontally from top to bottom of the screen. Having previously owned multiple iPads and iPhones that never showed this issue I decided to return the product as faulty, and that's when the problem arose.The seller contacted me on receipt of the returned iPad showing me a picture or the fault on the screen and said that it was damaged and they would need to replace the screen and therefore could only refund me 60% of the ¬£379.99 I had paid which left me out of pocket by ¬£147.99 plus P&P.I replied saying this was not damage but a fault, however the seller has completely ignored my request for a full refund or a replacement product and won't respond to my messages, so have escalated this to an official complaint to Amazon.As I write (20th June 2023) I am now waiting for Amazon to respond to my complaint about the seller, so when they have looked into it and responded I will update this post.Hopefully it will be a satisfactory outcome.Gavin A.23rd June 2023.Good news to report, and Bravo to Amazon for refunding me the balance that the seller wouldn't.I don't know the outcome as to whether Amazon has claimed this back from the seller or not, but either way I am fully refunded. So 5 x Stars to Amazon *****I still want another iPad so will start looking again, still no response or replies from the seller, so, needless to say I will be avoiding EXPESS GADGETS in future.My recommendation, be very wary of this seller.

Product Title: Apple 2022 10.9-inch iPad (Wi-Fi, 64GB) - Yellow (10th generation)
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Much the same, but...
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 August 2023
Review - Body: Lovely product as always, but rather let down by its inability to use the latest Ipen, and very little warning that this is the case. Older pen not as good requiring wire to charge and then not being usable whilst charging. Also requires a wee adapter which just adds to charging annoyance (which we all know leads to things not being charged, and often dying) a bit sad the latest ipad doesn't allow latest pen, and that it feels like Apple is trying to force upgrades. Which would work better if people knew it was an issue, I would've probably bought different version if I had known. And yes, we should probably research this before hand, but this is where Apple usually are, very in house and compatible with their own devices.Also annoying with the main weather applet being displayed when GPS never works, it simply can never find where I am, and although can add places the main screen really wants to display the first option. Meaning you have a big ugly empty Applet on your main screen. Again, not what you expect from Apple. But after much researching found the way around it and the optionsto make it display what I wanted, albeit all rather hidden.But that's only complaints and doesn't detract from what is still a quality product with a lovely display. For what we use ot for it is lovely. It replaces an original Air which was getting a bit long in the tooth, and battery life now practically dead. Also software versions becoming more problematic
Review - Format: Style Name: Wi-FiSize Name: 64 GBColour Name: BlueVerified Purchase

Product Title: Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones in Ear 2022 Wireless Headphones with HD Mic, Wireless Earphones Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Earphones IP7 Waterproof Earbuds, 40H Deep Bass/USB-C/LED Display
Review - Title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    these are ok, disappointed that "noise cancelling" function is not what the description implies
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 November 2022
Review - Body: These are only ok.If you're looking for earbuds and don't want to spend "Sony" money, then these are somewhat good candidates. Too bad they _don't_ have the noise cancelling functionality that the headline description implies they do. If I'd managed to glean that info from a full description vs. headline description comparison, then I wouldn't have purchased them.Pros:1) Can't fault the sound quality, though I am no audiophile. They compare favourably to (though certainly don't exceed) the sound quality of a set of Sony WF-1000XM4 earbuds that I've used extensively.2) I very much like the LED power level on the case, hugely useful. I also like that the case charges via USB-C.3) Being able to use either the right or the left earbud independently is also very useful.4) When they are in my ears, they can be quite comfortable (though I don't use them for sports)5) Batteries do last longer than the Sonys, but those are over a year old, so I don't expect them to perform at their best in that respect.Minor Cons1) They are a little awkward to get out of their case, a bit of a surprising design fault (takes a "scooping" technique, and sometimes this leads to me pressing the touch-sensitive button, and then that function happens unexpectedly)2) None of the 3 sizes of silicone eartips work to create a good seal in my particular ear canals (really necessary to get a good bass response). I have to really force them in while twisting a bit to get the best performance. I'm going to have to source a foam alternative (the Sonys are far better in that respect: they always made a perfect seal due to their their shape + foam eartips).3) despite the photos in the product's page here on Amazon, the touch-sensitive area _is not_ the tubular structure, rather it's the side of the body of the earbuds (easy to figure out though).Major ConWhat really annoys me about them is that I found them after doing a search for "noise cancelling" here on Amazon, but they aren't what a reasonable person would accept as noise cancelling earbuds. The description contains: "...Wireless Earphones Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Earphones...", but the "noise cancelling" is just for calls, definitely _not_ what I would expect from the headline description. I was quite disappointed about that (yes yes, the "noise cancelling while calling" functionality is described deeper in the product page, but I don't feel it's reasonable for me to have to carefully compare two bodies of information in a single page in order to determine the _real_ functions of a product). I bought these specifically for my office, where there are many computer fans going at all times. I can still hear all that fan noise with these in (even if I manage to make a good seal). Disappointing.SummarySo if  you're looking to for some decent true wireless earbuds at far below what you'd pay for Sony/Bose/Jabra/etc versions, then these are worth checking out. Just beware of all the caveats.
Special feature: Supper Lightweight; HD Mic; Upgraded Bluetoth 5.3; Hi-Fi Stereo Deep Bass; CVC 8.0 Noise Cancelling; Upgraded Earhook Designed For Sport; One-Step Auto Pairing; IP-X7 Waterproof; Individual LED Power Display; Touch Control,Stylish Control PanelSupper Lightweight; HD Mic; Upgraded Bluetoth 5.3; Hi-Fi Stereo Deep Bass; CVC 8.0 Noise Canc‚Ä¶

Review - Title: Terrible- Stopped after 2 weeks

Review - Body: Took a chance on this and it missed. Most people who gave it a good review only did so right after purchase. Ive had it for a month now and here is my review. Product Title: Wireless Headphones, Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sports Wireless Earbuds Hifi Stereo Noise Cancelling Headphones with HD Mic, 50H Playtime Bluetooth Earphones Dual LED Display, USB-C, IP7 Waterproof, Gym
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Convenient; acceptable value
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 February 2023
Review - Body: UPDATED REVIEWFound a Christmas Amazon gift voucher I'd put aside, and bought these earbuds on impulse.Well, perhaps not impulse exactly - I've been considering such things for the past two years.  Then I saw these at under ¬£20 with a small discount.  My belated present was delivered a few days ago.  Sadly, sometime over the past few weeks - or do I mean decades? - I've become old.  First, I couldn't get through the shrink-wrap cellophane.  Broke two nails in the attempt.  Finally let out a war cry and attacked the packet with scissors.  Success!  Except the inner smooth cardboard box is of the drawer type, and lacking any method of pushing / pulling it out.  Oops, another torn nail.  I must remember to ask the GP to check my blood pressure!!!  Finally got into the package and extracted the instruction manual.  Which is written in microscopic print, surely less than 5 point.  Now - where did I put my specs and that magnifying glass???Having finally managed to decipher the instructions, I charged the box and earbuds.  Perhaps I'm not so far over the hill after all - charging them, and pairing them to my phone and mp3 player, was easy!I watched some catch-up TV on my phone to test-drive the buds.  The sound was fine, though I accidentally jumped to the previous episode while trying to move some hair out of my eye and put my specs on.  I was pleased to find other reviewers are right, and I can indeed wear my spectacles comfortably with the earbuds.After locating the reset button in the charging box, I then paired the earbuds with my less-than-up-to-date mp3 player.  Also simple, and works well.I listen to a lot of classical music, and like sonorous bass tones.  These earbuds are convenient if I want to listen while I'm doing something else - but if I'm sitting down listening properly, I'll stick with my wired earphones.  The sound on these is okay (can be really good, if only I can fit the buds correctly), but I have very narrow ear canals, and have to push them in uncomfortably hard - otherwise, I lose most of the bass tones and get a rather "tinny" treble.  Plus, the buds tend to work out of my ear a bit over time.  Shoving them back in is difficult without accidentally altering the volume or changing track!The tap buttons work well - if you can locate them!  Too well, sometimes: brushing a hand or coat hood against them can change settings!On the positive side - I love the lack of wires!  My wired headphones fit my ears comfortably, and have an excellent tone - but I'm constantly ripping them out of my ears when dealing with the laundry; dipping them in the water when washing up; tangling them round passing door handles / tree branches / etc when on the move.  These sit snugly in my ears and mind their own business while I'm busy with other things.I've always had a problem with earphones - over the ear, in the ear, whatever - the pressure very quickly making my ears very painful.  The right earbud continues that tradition - but amazingly, the left one is comfortable!  The over-ear loop makes the buds sit securely, and I'm not worried that they'll pop out and bury themselves in the depths of the dustbin, toilet, or wherever.Overall, good value, and adequate sound.  But perhaps not the best for people with very narrow ear canals ...

Product Title: Wireless Headphones, Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sports Wireless Earbuds Hifi Stereo Noise Cancelling Headphones with HD Mic, 50H Playtime Bluetooth Earphones Dual LED Display, USB-C, IP7 Waterproof, Gym
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    DECENT FOR THE PRICE
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 May 2023
Review - Body: I have had (and lost) plenty of these type of headphones and these are the best of the cheaper ones I have had. They have the ability to use just  a single earbud as a bluetooth handsfree when I need the facility, and just one of these earbuds is plenty loud enough for this purpose. I also use them for running and they stay in place and are quite comfortable. The noise cancellation is more than adequate and the quality of sound is good. Volume levels are better than most.I really can't get used to the tapping sensors for volume control and pausing/answering calls. They don't seem instantly responsive and it does get frustrating. Hard buttons for me everyday.For the price, these are definitely worth a puntUPDATE 27/9/23As usual, I lost one of the earbuds and bought a second pair, thinking I would have a spare left earbud. This was not the case as they I couldn't sync the older earbud with the newer ones, even though they were the exact same model. Not too long after I bought the second pair, the left earbud just stopped charging. I cleaned all the charging points and did a reset - all to no avail. I then had  an older left and a newer right earbud, which I could only use one at a time! And now, the newer right earbud doesn't charge! And the remaining left earbud constantly disconnects from my device.My advice would be to avoid these and look at buying a decent set from a known brand, as these cheaper ones probably work out more expensive in the long run.

5.0 out of 5 stars

Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 October 2023
Review - Body: I've tried over 20+ headphones in a span of 15 or so years, using various inexpensive brand (except for the likes of Apple or Bose, Marshalls etc. due to my budget) and these are the best that I have found. The Bluetooth connection and sound quality is the clearest I have experienced. They are light weight and easy to clean - not bulky at all.The charge doesn't take a long time. I tend to use 1 earphone at a time and it doesn't effect the sound quality.I don't use the app, as I don't personally find the need to. A pop up appears with the battery percentage and stating either right or left ear bud, once connected to my phone - this is without downloading the app.These are the second pair I've brought and gifted to my brother after purchasing my personal pair from Argos. They are the same price (at the time of purchase), it was purely for the convenience of next day delivery via Amazon. In my opinion, these are genuine JBL, just as the pair I previously brought from Argos.

Product Title: Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones In Ear with 4 ENC Noise Cancelling Mic, 2023 Bluetooth Earphones Mini HI-FI Stereo Sound, LED Display Wireless Headphones 36H Playtime IP7 Waterproof White
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Take's some fiddling about to get working!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 September 2023
Review - Body: Since my original review I've spent some time with these little beauties and I've now upgraded my STAR RATING from 3 to 5. Sound quality is pretty good on the bass and treble. Volume good. I reckon the original review was a little harsh but I now feel I understand why only one earbud worked at a time and I can manually switch off/on either as desired by simply holding (with a finger) for more than 2/3 seconds. Groovy baby...Got the package on time. Neatly packaged. Instruction manual too small. Needed a mouse to read and verbally advise!!! Haven't got one of those yet.First time out of the box (charging case) display indicated the charge at 100%. Put back immediately and charge dropped quickly to 92% (Confusing) - not plugged into mains.Decided to pair with my mobile but only Left earbud worked. Disconnected and placed back into charge case.Tried to pair with my PC (Windows 11) and this time only Right earbud worked. Disconnected and placed back into case.Re-tried the mobile, this time only the Right earbud worked!Put both back into charge case for an hour (or two).Took both out of the case and monitored the pulsating light of each earbud (trying to pair). The pulse of R was 3x to that of L. Tried pairing to the mobile. Both lights went out when paired but sound stronger on R to that of L.Reverted to PC. NB: You cannot pair to multiple devices at the same time. You must disconnect again from mobile before moving onto another pair. As sonn as I disconnected the PC paired up.Used Windows 11 Settings and Advanced Sound (Volume Mixer) to test further. Setting the basic level for the app to 60% improved the balance between the 2 earbuds (L&R).Didn't note any Noise Cancellation in effect! Only increasing volume seemed to cancel outer surrounding noise levels.Moved back to 'mobile' test. Disconnected from PC and got audible confirmation. Connected to 'A90 Pro' via mobile and confirmed connection for Audio & Calls but, no sound on play back through Apps.Looks like another reset. There is a serious issue with the firmware within these little devices that needs serious attention to be considered.Returned to testing again today. The pairing continued with the mobile with (L)&(R) both working.Testing extended to features as detailed: Volume, Jump Fwd, Jump Bck, etc all worked. Touching the earbuds is a bit sensitive. Also, Siri volume way louder than the level set by which ever technology.These earbuds are not really ideal for Sports. The slightest inbalance and they will fall out so I don't see any point in testing them for sport activities whether jogging, gym, or even any activity beyound sleeping and walking!As for the phone use and microphone, again, I won't be testing as I have no need for that use. Purely listening to so I haven't got to hear the kids but, yet gain the Noise Cancelling doesn't work.

Product Title: Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones In Ear with 4 ENC Noise Cancelling Mic, 2023 Bluetooth Earphones Mini HI-FI Stereo Sound, LED Display Wireless Headphones 36H Playtime IP7 Waterproof White
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great sound and price
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 October 2023
Review - Body: I've used most day for 6 weeks now.Pros - The overall sound is good, deep bass and crisp highs. At medium volume levels they cancel almost all outside noise.At the moment the battery life is good too, I've only had to fully charge the case once and I use about 1-2 hours a day. (5-10 a week) The case clearly displays battery levels is very handy. That said its still early days.Cons - The ear buds were all too big for my ears, to the point were they hurt my ears. I had to use some from my old headphones. I don't have small earholes.My biggest gripe are touch controls. For me they are counter intuitive. Press and hold for 1.5 seconds to skip track and double tap is off/pause, it may not be an issue for you but it should be the other way around. There is also about a half a second input delay when you double or single tap to adjust the volume which can be a little inconvenient when you're out and about when your finding a track or you need to hear something else such as a travel announcement.Overall they sound great and for the price point it outweights the negatives. Yes, there are better headphones but I think you're getting deminishing returns the more you pay.

Product Title: Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones In Ear with 4 ENC Noise Cancelling Mic, 2023 Bluetooth Earphones Mini HI-FI Stereo Sound, LED Display Wireless Headphones 36H Playtime IP7 Waterproof White
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Noise cancelling yet to be seen.
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 August 2023
Review - Body: My Microsoft Surface headphones where dying of old age. And i thought I'll give a try to earbuds. Never had those and not sure what to expect. But then for that price you can't go wrong. Or do you?I have unusually shaped ears thus headphones where alway difficult for me to get used to. Same here toi. Regarding of how would i put them in, or change rubber, there's always feeling they will fall off. Thus constant adjustment and trying to fit them better. And for first few days i was accidentally put volume down / uoyor pause music or skip to another track... Fun times until you learn how to properly grab them if you need adjustment.Pairing was bit awkward as there was no ligt indicating buds ready to pair. Though its duw to no juice but that wasn't the issue. After few days and cew more trying it just decided to work. It does takes a while for Bluetooth to discover them once they are out of case. Tried on pc, raspberry pi and MBA. Same results. So its definitely buds. Ill say uo to 2 minutes for them to be visible once you take them off from case.Charging was not an issue. Used power charger that came with my mobile. First i charged case, then inserted buds and job done. Music wise?I went from Burzum, through Meshuggah, Sun ra... Many different genres and types of music. There's good side and bad side. Some sounds good, others lack in vocals. Buds are nit heavy in bass so you will not get headache by listening to Blutonium Boy or Westbam. Listening to jap punk is also a joy. But if you're fun of BMTH well sad news. Quick response, great swap from lo to high and back.Why 4 stars? Not sure where or how you do noise cancelling. Also if you coming from on ear / over the ear headphones... Review - Title:

    High-Performance Wireless Earbuds: An Honest Review
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 October 2023
Review - Body: I recently purchased the Btootos Wireless Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.3, and they have mostly exceeded my expectations. These earbuds have quickly become an integral part of my daily routine, and I am mostly thrilled with their performance.Let's start with the sound quality. The deep bass and stereo sound these earbuds deliver are nothing short of amazing. Whether I'm listening to my favorite music, podcasts, or taking calls, the audio quality is crystal clear with rich, immersive sound. It truly enhances my listening experience.The active noise cancellation (ENC) technology is another standout feature. It's very effective at minimizing background noise, allowing me to fully immerse myself in whatever I'm listening to. For most situations, it's like having a personal sanctuary of sound.However, there's a slight drawback when it comes to the earbuds' performance in very noisy environments. While they excel in most situations, they can struggle to maintain the same level of noise cancellation in extremely loud surroundings. In these cases, some background noise does seep through, making it a bit challenging to hear clearly.The four built-in noise-canceling microphones are generally good for calls. I've had many clear phone conversations in normal noise conditions, and the people on the other end of the line have also noticed the improved call quality.Battery life is still a strong point, with 36 hours of playtime on a single charge, and the Bluetooth 5.3 connectivity remains reliable.In conclusion, the Btootos Wireless Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.3 deliver excellent sound quality, effective noise cancellation in most scenarios, and impressive microphone performance. However, they may not be the best choice for very noisy environments where some background noise can still be heard. Despite this limitation, these earbuds have become an essential part of my daily life, and I'm generally satisfied with my purchase.

Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great design and extremely reliable
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 September 2023
Review - Body: I bought four. They are designed so well, and the earbuds fit neatly into the, pleasingly round and robust, case. At 20 sovs, I got several for myself and a couple as birthday gifts. I'm with the vinyl generation but I love MP3s FLAC files and small tech like this. I'm no audiophile so I can't pretend to be an expert, but these ear-buds and mega convenient, super compact and they sound great with both music and radio chat. There is certainly enough bass so the sound doesn't sound like it's coming from inside a Coke can, as can so often be the case. I've never worried about charging. They seem to last forever. I use one pair with my mobile and another with the PC to watch movies and videos. There is a lag of about 400ms with video but this can always be corrected by using the "J" and "K" shortcut keys in VLC - I find that just tapping the "J" key several times, to bump up the audio delay to -400ms usually does the trick. The ear-buds connect automatically so all I have to do is take the left one out of its box, and the PC (W11) connects automatically. The mobile connects in the same way. Then the moment you put the earbuds back in their case, they disconnect and the sound source reverts to the default. The price fluctuates with regularity but they are around 20 sovs every couple of weeks, so maybe watch, wait, then buy.

They are also approved by a team of engineers and developers who ensure that the envelopes meet the highest standards of performance and security.I highly recommend these #10 security envelopes from Aimoh to anyone of my friends who is looking for a secure and professional way to mail their documents. Review - Body: I needed some new earphones to replace my old Bose that were 5 years old.I didn't want to spend the ¬£270 for the AirPods Pro - these are the closest thing to it for an iPhone user for ¬£100 less!Because they are owned by Apple and they use the apple chip, they connected just as easily with iPhone as AirPods.I love this blue colour.The sound is very good.Comfort is great - I use them for running and never feel that they will fall outThey are water resistant - one fell into a cup of coffee for a few seconds but it didn't affect the earbud (phew!)The tapping is very good - you press once to pause or start. Also great memory, when you put them in your ear they automatically come on and continue the music you last had on Spotify if you click them.ALSO NO DUMB AI VOICE, just 2 beeps to indicate low battery then they just die after maybe another hour of use.The fact they are designed as buttons and not touch screen is also beneficial, if you bump them and the music pauses, you could just use your shoulder to click them back on and not need to have a hand free to stick your music back on.So yeah, they're good.

Review - Body: I had AirPods Pro 2 but for some reason, no matter what tips I used, they wouldn‚Äôt stay put in my ears. I didn‚Äôt know that Apple had acquired Beats and make the Beats range but these have the same H2 and U2 chips the AirPods Pro 2 do so they do all the same tricks, including showing up in ‚ÄúFind My‚Äù, head tracking Spatial Audio, transparency mode etc etc. They have a better battery life and they are definitely louder - I thought it was the Apple software limiting the volume of the AirPods, but these are way louder! Product Title: Beats Fit Pro ‚Äì True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds ‚Äì Active Noise Cancelling - Sweat Resistant Earphones, Compatible with Apple & Android, Class 1 Bluetooth¬Æ, Built-in Microphone ‚Äì Black
Review - Title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great sound, but many annoying flaws
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 September 2023
Review - Body: Do not get me wrong, once the noise cancelling works, it is pretty good, the same can be said about the sound, even though these are stronger on the bass, which some people do not like. They look good and sound good, so why did I return them?1. The case - which on its own is not that big of a deal, but it has really poor quality. I have seen better cases being made for half the price of these - the hinges feel like they can fall apart any time.2. The BUTTON! - which is the most annoying feature on these, in order to properly fit them in your ears, as well as to utilise the noise cancelling feature, you have to push them into your ears, now the issue is that pretty much the entire surface that you are pushing on is the actual button, meaning every single time I would try to put them in my ears, I would accidentally press the button and music would start playing.3. The wings - The wings work pretty well at making sure the buds do not fall out. However, in my case, it would become uncomfortable to wear these after an hour due to the wing pushing against my left ear exclusively, but this will really depend on the shape of your ears.4. The noise cancellation - which sometimes does not work, unless the buds detect that they are properly located in your ears, which they were, and they still would not recognise, forcing you to remove them and put them in again (once again triggering my 3rd issue every time).5. The app - The app is great and responsive, even though it does not have much in terms of sound optimization. However, when it asks you to do an update of the firmware, the notification does not go away from your home screen until you do that. That would not be an issue once in a while, but within the first week of the purchase, this would already happen twice, forcing me to do the firmware update immediately in order for the notification to go away.At the end of the day, the main positive features of these are sound and noise cancellation. However, just for those alone, I could not justify paying double the amount that my current buds (Samsung, probably 4 years old at this point) are worth, which do not come with any of the issues mentioned, but their sound and noise cancellation are "only" 90% as good as these.

Product Title: Beats Fit Pro ‚Äì True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds ‚Äì Active Noise Cancelling - Sweat Resistant Earphones, Compatible with Apple & Android, Class 1 Bluetooth¬Æ, Built-in Microphone ‚Äì Black
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    The default gym earphones choice
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 July 2023
Review - Body: It has been hard to find a good pair of earphones for the gym - having researched an honestly ridiculous amount and bought way too many headphones I had to end up spending a bit more than I wanted to buy these but after the struggle I can confidently say that they are what I would consider the default choice for gym earphones if you want something that stays in your ears, blocks out most external noise, is stable/relatively comfortable and gets you pumping in the gym. The only downside (apart from the price) is that I cannot have these in my ears more than 3 hours but no gym workout should last that long. They are more stable than AirPods (don't recommend for the gym) as well as most other wireless earbuds I've bought (Jabra Elites, Sonys, other random brands on Amazon). The eartips work well to prevent shifting within the ear when running. The competitor is the Powerbeats pro which I was preferring until I realised how old the tech was - I think this is most likely going to be a better solution for most people. If you are concerned about the stability in the ear vs the Powerbeats pro I wouldn't be concerned - these are highly stable with the eartips alone and I would wager are more stable as I found earbuds with loops tend to shift about when running historically.

These headphones offer a premium audio experience at an affordable price, making them a fantastic choice for music enthusiasts and anyone seeking high-quality sound.Upon receiving the A10 Pro Headphones, I was immediately impressed with their sleek and stylish design. The build quality felt sturdy and durable, giving me confidence that these headphones were built to last. The attention to detail in their construction is evident, making them visually appealing as well.Pairing the A10 Pro Headphones with my iPhone was a breeze. The seamless and hassle-free pairing process allowed me to connect them quickly, and I was ready to enjoy my favorite music in no time. The simplicity of the setup was a definite plus, as I appreciate products that prioritize ease of use.Once connected, I opened up Spotify and started playing some tunes. The sound quality of the A10 Pro Headphones blew me away. The depth and clarity of the audio were remarkable, allowing me to immerse myself fully in the music. Every note and beat came through with impressive precision, making me feel as if I were in a live concert.The noise cancellation capability of the A10 Pro Headphones is outstanding. I decided to put it to the test by asking my partner to engage me in conversation while I was listening to music. To my surprise, I couldn't hear a word they said. The headphones effectively blocked out any external distractions, creating a serene and uninterrupted listening experience.Additionally, I wanted to ensure that the headphones didn't leak sound, as I've experienced that issue with other headphones before. I asked my partner if they could hear any music coming from the headphones, and they confirmed that there was no audible sound leakage. This feature is essential for maintaining privacy and ensuring considerate listening, particularly in public settings.In conclusion, I wholeheartedly recommend the A10 Pro Headphones to anyone seeking a superior audio experience without breaking the bank. These headphones offer impressive sound quality, easy connectivity, and excellent noise cancellation. Their sleek design and durable build make them a reliable choice for daily use. Whether you're a music aficionado or simply someone who appreciates immersive audio, the A10 Pro Headphones provide exceptional value for money.

Product Title: Apple AirPods (3rd generation) (Renewed), Wireless, White
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great price and work like new
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 April 2023
Review - Body: I've had these for a couple of months and they work perfectly despite being renewed. It's a great fit into my ears as well as my current Apple ecosystem!Obviously, you aren't getting these for their sound quality (even if they sound much better than previous models) but for practicality and everyday use, it gets 5 stars on that front.Spatial audio is a great addition which I mainly use whilst travelling on the underground. Fixed is fine but I find head tracking to be a novelty feature which does work but I don't normally use it. What's smart is that it remembers to switch between fixed and head tracking for different media. So if I'm listening to music it's fixed but if I watch a video it switches automatically to head tracking.If you want noise cancelling then look elsewhere. these aren't it. You'll have to pay more for the Pros or accept that you will have to get cheaper probably better-sounding earbuds but they won't have that Apple integration which you have with these.Can't control the volume from the AirPods which isn't great as I have an Apple watch I still don't need to get my phone out to change the volume...bear that in mind as can be annoyingSo yeah 5 stars for the overall experience using these headphones in my existing Apple ecosystem but I am not stupid enough to know there are better earbuds out there but none will work as seamlessly as this if you happen to own a MacBook, iPhone or Apple Watch.

Product Title: Rulefiss Wireless Earbuds, Wireless Headphones with HD Mic Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones, Stereo Noise Cancelling Earbud, 48H Wireless Earphones Dual LED Display, USB-C, IP7 Waterproof for Sports, Purple
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Honestly .. Still Deciding ..
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 August 2023
Review - Body: Ordered the Wireless Earbuds on the 4th and they were delivered on the 5th July, very efficient; have been using them for the last 40+ days and the right ear bud has gone into an intermittent charging mode ..Pros ..(1) very good bass and treble; the noise cancellation is sufficient to mask out external noises whilst being used in the gym.(2) supplied ear buds fits my ears ( select the best fitting from small, medium, large ) and the ear hooks provides additional confidence that the earbuds will not fall out during a run; both the ear hooks and ear buds were soft and comfortable.(3) battery life appears to be of good length; two hours in the gym and the ear buds were down to 90% as shown on the mobile phone.Cons ..(1) after about 40+ days, the right ear piece has stopped charging , the charge case is at 97% , the left ear piece is charging fine , but NOT the right piece.Cleaned all the contacts points, especially after gym use; tried multiple USB charging cables and USB chargers ; right ear piece is now charging intermittently ( makes me wonder if this is really IP 7 rated ), fingers crossed it will charge fully.Honestly, if it had been within the 30 day period ( unfortunately out by 10 days !! ), would have just returned it ; currently in communications with Seller .. watch this space for an update !!!In summary , this could be one of the best wireless hooked sports earbuds, but if it only last for 40 days ...Update as of 24th August 2023:The Customer Service Team has been magnificent; after contacting them regarding the faulty right earbud (appears that I may have been unlucky and ended up with a dud battery), they have sent me a new Q38 Wireless earbuds under warranty to completely replace the previous faulty pair.Just this Service and Support alone is worth 4+ stars and as previously reviewed above, these sports wireless earbuds are exceptional in their sound and comfort.Fingers crossed these replacements will last longer !!

Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great for the price
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 May 2023
Review - Body: I was after a cheap pair of over the ear headphones and opted for these partly due to price but also the positive reviews. I'm not usually a pink colour fan but decided to try these having seen another picture review I liked how the colour was against the persons skin colour which is like mine. Pleased to say I'm actually really happy with my colour choice as they are a lovely light pink/rose gold.The earphone is like a smooth silicone feel which I love, I wish the case was the same but that's just personal preference. In my opinion if you have large ears these may be too small or uncomfortable behind the ear as the part that slots over the ear is smaller then I imagined.I easily paired these with my Samsung phone by putting on Bluetooth and scanning they came straight up. I have listened to Spotify, Amazon Music and the 4 App all without issues when pausing and playing.The sound quality I felt was fantastic, honestly as good as my Samsung buds. I have asked people around me whether they could hear my music when played at high volume and all said no which would have been a deal breaker for me if they could. The earphones charge when left inside the case and I like that it tells you how much percentage of charge is left also you can see the battery bars to indicate when they are fully charged.I've literally convinced everyone in the family to purchase these but there is one thing that I only discovered last night which has let me down and may be the only reason I might return these. I like to use them before sleeping in a dark room and I realised they have a really annoying flashing red light on both ear piece which was bothering me as it was flashing on the wall next to my bed. May not bother some but if my husband was laying next to me wearing them then the flashing would have definitely bothered me. Wonder if there is a way to turn this off can't see any information for this though. Shame as other then that I love them! If the flashing light wouldn't bother you then these are worth every penny but if it is something that would then look elsewhere.

Product Title: Sony WF-C500 True Wireless Headphones (Up to 20 Hours Battery Life with Charging Case - Compatible with Voice Assistant, Built-in Microphone for Phone Calls, Bluetooth) Black
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great product, built to last!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 April 2023
Review - Body: I was given a pair of these 2 years ago as a present and love them so much that I bought a pair for someone else's birthday.  PLEASE BEAR IN MIND: these photos are after 2 years of daily use so they look a little battered!  Obviously they arrived pristine :)For reference, I use these twice daily: one 1-3 hour use with a single bud, and one 1hr use with both buds), and once or twice a month for 4-5 hours with both buds.  They have definitely risen to the challenge.1. SOUND. I'm not a music buff so don't know how the sound quality of these would compare to more expensive or professional products, but I've found they produce well-balanced music at a high quality (i.e. no tinny sounds, decent bass) and no voice distortion in spoken word.  I mainly use them for audiobooks and they've been excellent.  If I'm in a noisy environment (I'm talking cooking with the extractor hood on, or the footie on TV husband-based commentary thereof, not a full-blown concert or anything) they do a great job of blocking out the room noise and delivering my own noise straight to my ear without having to have the volume deafeningly high.  They're not really noise-"cancelling", but they negate enough of the unwanted noise for it to not be a distraction, and work well for my own purposes.2. DURABILITY.  As I say, I've had mine for 2 years and they have been put through the ringer; 90% of their use is outdoors on dog walks. I live near the beach so they have been dropped in the sand and dirt, sat loose (i.e. out of their case) in sandy pockets, generally been battered about and abused and they're still working perfectly.  The flexible in-ear parts can be easily removed for cleaning, if needed.The recesses in the case can be a bit fiddle to clean (though I'm not sure you'd normally ned to as I'm sure most people will treat theirs far better than me!) but a cotton bud and a quick blow and they're perfect.  The case itself is nice and sturdy and, even though I have the white version it still looks in good nick, especially considering the amount of dirt it's been dragged through.3. BATTERY.  When you first take them out of the case, a voice tells you "battery fully charged" / "battery, about X%".  I use mine for on average 2 hours but up to 5hrs at one time before popping back in the case and I've never had a low battery warning (I'm assuming there would be one in-ear if they got low).  Very occasionally I'll get a "battery about 70%" warning in which case when I get home I pop the case on charge and forget about it, but battery just hasn't been an issue for me and I've never heard lower than that.  I can't tell you how quickly they charge because I've never had to time it but the case is always fully charged after around an hour I'd guess.The 'case as a charging unit' is a fantastic design feature and really useful when on the go.  The metal charging connectors have never once failed, despite all the dust and dirt they've been dragged through.  The magnetic areas mean they snap back into the case perfectly every time, and they're definitely secure in there, even with the case open.  They also snap together if they're loose, which is useful if you've dumped them both in your pocket!4. COMFORT.  As they are relatively large, I'm surprised at how well they fit & sit in the ear.  The only time I notice them wiggling loose is if I'm gardening and spending a lot of time jiggling about with my head lowered.  And even then, a quick press and they're back in place. With normal, upright behaviour they stay in place for hours.  They are comfortable enough that you forget they're there.5.  CONTROLS.  I tend to just use the right one (I'm a woman walking alone so only have a single earbud in) which has the pause/play/skip chapter/answer call control.  It's a big old button (so very easy to use/no chance of missing it), works quickly, and when you restart it will usually rewind a second or two so you're not missing anything.  A long press skips forward to the next chapter/song. If you're listening to something and a call comes through, it knows to pause your music/book and automatically resume once you've hung up, so no faffing about digging out your phone again. Left earbud is volume control (single press: volume up / long press: volume down) and, again, is responsive and doesn't race through the volume levels too quickly, so you're able to adjust easily.6. OTHER POINTS.  Bluetooth setup was quick and easy (both on phone and laptop), and it connects quickly (another voice in your ear tells you "bluetooth connected/disconnected").  Charging is quick and simple: orange light on the earbuds when charging / orange light on the case and earbuds when plugged in to a cable. When first removed from the case the buds flash blue twice to show they're on and working, then some more blue flashes to show bluetooth connection status. There are various other flashing/colour combinations to indicate different things which are listed in the paperwork if you're interested. There's also some 3D sound system you can download (I never explored this) so I'd imagine you can tweak the levels if you want to.  The case design is lovely; it's smooth and rounded and feels pleasant in-hand.IN SUMMARY: these are excellent.  As I said, I'm no professional sound person, but if you want something that gives you solid sound quality, and will stand up to everyday use and abuse I would *highly* recommend these.  They're a good price for a quality little product and they're definitely built to last.

Review - Title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Good earphones with amazing sound quality and fit.. ruined buy awful side buttons!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 October 2023
Review - Body: I bought a bunch of earphones from amazon within the same price range as this one to test them out and see which one sounded/fit best and this one was the absolute best out of them all.The sound quality and clarity is amazing, mind you i am a casual user and not an audiophile. They also fit surprisingly well for how bulky they are and you forget they are in your ears after a while. The choice of earbud replacements it comes with should cover most if not all people's needs as it did with mine.The battery life on these is also quite impressive but not as good as the TOZO brands as i owned a pair of TOZOs before and they lasted a bit more.All in all i have no complaints in regards to sound quality and fit like most people have however what really REALLY bothers me is the buttons on these earphones. Not only are they useless, they are also really frustrating to keep in your pocket. The slightest nudge or bump and the buttons on the side get pressed and they start messing with your phone. Another issue is that if you are trying to connect to another pair of headphones while you have these in your pocket it is practically impossible to do as they keep reconnecting because the button gets pressed really easily. So to fix this you need to take them out of your pocket and put them in the case which doesn't sound like too much work but doing it every day and every time you want to switch headphones it can become quite frustrating.I have also found that the gestures/button combinations they use for the earphones don't really make sense to me so i have not been using them at all.All in all i would definitely recommend these if what i mentioned above doesn't sound like something that will bother you.. But for me personally i would not buy them if i knew what i know now.

Product Title: JBL Tune 230NC TWS In-Ear Headphones - True Wireless Bluetooth headphones in charging case with Active Noise Cancelling and up to 40 hours battery life, in black
Review - Title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great sound, battery life & ANC!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 February 2023
Review - Body: I used to love my Soundcore buds, but after 3 replacements due to issues and decreasing battery life (only after less than 6 months), I was in search of another brand in the ¬£50 or under range. Nothing fancy, just some buds I can keep in for most of day while I work at home . After testing handful of 'cheap' (under ¬£20) wireless earbuds with very bad tinny/dull sound quality that I ended up returning, I factored that I needed to increase my budget. After careful research and reading positive reviews and watching video reviews that said great things about these JBLs, I took the plunge and purchased them. From the moment I took them out the box, and fitted them in my ears (very comfortably) and powered them on and played a song I was in awe of the sound quality, the bass booms, and the mids and highs are there, (this is BEFORE) I customised the App EQ. Also, the noise cancellation is amazing - cuts out virtually all background noise, and to top it off the battery life has been amazing. I think I wore them for 6-7 hours with a full charge, but could have been more. Either way, I'm happy with these buds. The only thing I have to get used to are the touch controls which are preset but give you the option to chose what you want the touches to do, but its something I'll get used to once I use them more often. The charging case is nice and sturdy, and you get 2-3 spare earbud tips in various sizes. If you are after a pair of ANC wireless buds in the ¬£50 price mark I highly recommend these.UPDATE: September 2023.I purchased these earbuds in January 2023 and all was well and great up until I would say August or just before when the buds started to play upThe right earbud would not play.The right earbud not charging and battery life depleting as soon as put in earThen both earbuds not fully charging and having to retry a few times.Then battery life starting to get shorter and shorter after a full 100% charge.I don't know if this was just a faulty batch of earbuds or if this model is prone to these issues after a few months. The only way to find this out is buy asking for replacements/refund and repurchasing. If the same issues happen again then I will have my answer! Its a sham really as I while working properly in beginning I do love these earbuds. May do another update if I get new replacements. Watch this space!

Product Title: JBL Tune 230NC TWS In-Ear Headphones - True Wireless Bluetooth headphones in charging case with Active Noise Cancelling and up to 40 hours battery life, in black
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Decent for the price
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 November 2022
Review - Body: I have ASD and use earbuds on public transport, primarily to block out ambient noise.Until recently I've been using the  JBL 200TWS. I got them for a very good price and have been happy with their sound, simplicity and reliabilty. The only thing they lack is ANC and unless you play them at painful levels they don't block any background noise. ( I did manage to fit them with some Comply tips to improve passsive cancellation, but they won't fit the charging case).I've been looking at the 230NC since the price dropped but was wary of the number of reviews saying they were unreliable, so held out until the extended returns period started earlier this month.Soundwise, they offer an improvement in a quiet setting but on the bus they sound much the same as the 200's. Where they do offer a big improvement is in noise cancellation, with all but the most vocal of screaming babies being blocked. My only gripe about this is that it's not easy to turn ANC on/off without the app.They are also very bass heavy if you use the built-in EQ but I've now disabled it and use the flat setting in the Amazon music app which offers a more natural presentation.I really hope they remain reliable, as they offer a big improvement for me when travelling and are also enjoyable to use at home.

Review - Title:

    Great headphones for the price!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 June 2023
Review - Body: Great for this price point, quick and easy to connect and I can be heard reasonably well on calls. The sound quality for the other person is still better when I‚Äôm not using them though, which suggests that the mic isn‚Äôt the best quality. I love that you can tell how much battery power is left and appreciate the little warnings that you get when they‚Äôre in your ears and the battery starts to run low. I‚Äôve sometimes charged one earbud whilst I use the other, then switch over to preserve the power on a long phone call.I‚Äôve also used these in the gym, which is where I have my biggest complaint. The sound quality is tinny at best and the volume doesn‚Äôt go up nearly as loud as it ought to, in order to drown out the general hubbub of other machines, people‚Äôs voices and the groans of those flexing their best over in the free weights corner! In fact, the volume remains so incredibly low that I don‚Äôt even bother to use these in the gym anymore!The verdict is: get these if you need a reasonably priced pair of wireless headphones for calls of an ok sound quality. Otherwise, put the money towards getting something better or keep researching and when you find something amazing at a low price point, do let me know!

Product Title: Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones NEW Wireless Headphones with 4 ENC Mic, 56H Bluetooth Earphones in Ear Noise Cancelling Deep Bass, Mini Ear Buds Bluetooth Earbuds IP7 Waterproof LED Display
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great budget earbuds but touch control features can be fiddly and over sensitive at times...
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 October 2023
Review - Body: I got these after the first pair I purchased gave up the ghost after less than a year of moderate use. Not wanting to pay a fortune, I chose these wireless earbuds on the basis of the reviews and the fact that they looked like they would fit in my ears (other earbuds are too big and continuously pop out!).I've had these for a few months now and so far I've had a fairly positive experience with them. Connection with my phone was quick and easy to do on initial set up, sound quality is actually much better than my previous pair and the case feels sturdy and well made.I wasn't sure at first what the information on the small LCD screen on the front of the case was representing, but I've since worked it out. The percentage amount in the middle is how much charge is left in the case, whilst the two bars either side show how much charge is in each earbud.I easily get 2-3 hours of almost continuous listening time before these need recharging, which is a simple process of popping them back in their case. I'm not entirely sure how long they take to perform a full charge, but I've recharged mine for about an hour before and managed to get another 45-50 minutes of listening time before they've needed charging again.One thing I particularly like about these is the voice confirmation that plays when the earbuds first connect to my device (a slightly robotic female voice states 'connected') and again when the charge is running low (this time the robotic voice says something along the lines of 'charge running low'). My previous pair just beeped at me which was sometimes easy to miss, especially if I was listening to music on a higher volume.As for the sound quality, for the price I think it's actually pretty good. Music and podcasts are clear and crisp with no obvious distortions even when played at higher volumes. I don't think they have noise cancellation properties but they do block out a certain amount of external noise when I have them in, which is fine with me. I prefer to have an idea about what's going on around me, even when I'm listening to music to try and drown it out a bit!I only have one slight issue with these earbuds, which is the reason for my 4/5 rating. I'm still struggling to get to grips with the touch controls. The main issue is the double tap function meant to pause whatever is being played. As I'm left handed, I naturally gravitate to the left earbud for this feature, but 9 times out of 10 it'll turn the volume down or off instead of pausing whatever is playing. It's almost like the earbuds are too sensitive and as a result interpret any touch longer than half a second as a long touch, which is the action required to turn the volume down (right earbud turns it up). As a result, I often have to resort to turning the volume up and down on my phone instead which kind of negates having this feature in the earbuds!Overall though these are turning out to be a pretty decent set of earbuds, especially for the price. It remains to be seen how long they'll last but based on the cost and my experience so far, I'd be happy to purchase another pair if/when the time comes.

Review - Title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Good earbuds but easy to lose and not a step up in sound quality
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 September 2023
Review - Body: So I'm still in the middle of testing these but the short version is that compared to some cheaper wired together earbuds that I got more than 4 years ago these only beat them by having a lot more battery life and being able to tell how close they are to needing a new charge though only for the case. Sound quality is the same as is depth though the volume is very unweildly as for me it jumps much higher when I go from around 60-80% where one of those makes it so I can't really hear anything of the outside world. Oh yeah noise cancelling....no but I never expect that currently from any portal-able sound device.I have found the controls to be delayed or just activate when I brush them accidentally or do an different action all together which make me sorely miss the buttons on the wired together earbuds I have which are pretty nearly dead. Thing is they have the room for buttons to be put onto the buds compared to the earbuds I used in the past and I would much prefer them as I also found the delay to be so much so that I would need to wait a few seconds to allow for music to stop or for me to realize that I didn't trigger the sensor as there's no feedback.However when you are buying low you should expect there to be problems or issues which I did get with my wired together earbuds when I first got them and slowly got adjusted to them and learnt, I hope to do the same with these as their price is low and they do work for my phone which is more than I can say for some others I've tried where the the partnering bud wouldn't connect.When connected these to my computer the audio quality ended up being horrible like there was some bad connection or something hampering it, it was automatically set to max volume which when reduced did make the audio quality a bit better but still noticeable compared to my computer's headphone (but I did pay 100+ on them).These aren't suitable for anything more than casual use as the lack of ear hooks or way to secure them into the ears means that they easily fall out by even accidentally tapping them wrong or brushing them with clothing. Battery life is great though along with size of these and their case.....though the white version is not good as the display is blurred.

Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Pretty GOOD üòä VERY Happy with them
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 August 2023
Review - Body: Scroll half way through for my personal view on them.My sister was looking for cheap earbuds as she upgraded from her S8 phone. The new phones don't have a jack with them now.So for her birthday I got her these earbuds.They was in a lightening deal so was a little cheaper too. I decided to investigate the "REVIEWS" for these earbuds. As often you do find that the have a bunch of 5* all saying similar things. As if it was them reading a script.I found that there was a few people who had these earbuds and also had reviews for other earbuds too. It turned that they bought other 1s like this an then bought these as others had not been great.So it turns out that alot of the reviews are genuine and people's own experience of using them.*********My thoughts**********Very well packaged. They had good quality packaging, not as high quality as Apple Airpods or Galaxy Buds. As they're over ¬£100.These are between ¬£18-¬£25 depending on colour and the lightening deals on.They was simple to set up. They hold the Bluetooth signal very well. They don't have any noticeable lag with audio.They're easy to use on multiple devices. So if you have a mobile phone you use to listen to music and also a tablet then it's simple to switch if you watch a movie on the tablet etc.The case feels good quality too. Not massive in size, and not small and flimsy.The LED charge & battery remaining is a nice feature to have too. I use Galaxy Buds 2 and they only give the battery levels on my phone in the Galaxy wear App.Sound quality is surprisingly good.However, don't expect the same sound quality as other brands that cost between ¬£100 & ¬£300. That is not to say you will get bad sound as that's not the case.You just don't get the same as expensive Buds, things like noise cancelling, 360 sound, gaming sounds, an things like find my Galaxy buds or similar to apple airpods. For the price, occasional use if you went for a walk, the gym, or on holiday then these are fantastic earbuds.They are also good for using on a phone call too. They have a good mic and it was good quality sound on incoming voice as it was the voice quality on on the other person's side of the call.They have touch sensitive control as other expensive brands do.They do all the essential stuff you need like, answer call, end call, next track & previous track. There is more features but this requires reading the instructions, an they are easy to follow but there are some Chinese to English wording you have to try work out.They have a great battery life too. So I would definitely recommend these earbuds if you want a cheap pair that is good quality.Infact so good I bought another pair for my mum off my dad for their anniversary present.Hope this helps you decide too.

Product Title: Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones with 4 ENC Mic, 2023 Wireless Headphones In Ear 40H Deep Bass Bluetooth Earphones with Noise Cancelling, IP7 Waterproof Bluetooth Earbuds, LED Display/USB-C
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Decent Sound And Good Range
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 April 2023
Review - Body: These earbuds are around the 20 quid mark, so if you are looking for something that will provide for some serious hifi music enjoyment, look elsewhere or purchase some top end headphones. But for 20 quid how 'do' they sound? Pretty decent actually. Like all in-ear phones with silicone buds, you have to push them into your ear and achieve a 'seal' in order to hear stronger bass, and these buds give decent bass and also very reasonable mid and high tones. Using EQ on your device to enhance the sound is recommended.Bluetooth range is excellent: with my phone left in the living room I can walk all around the home listening to music without so much as a stutter.The battery life seems good. I listen to music for a couple of hours, sometimes after using them to watch a film, and they haven't ran out of juice on me yet. And they charge relatively quickly in their case too. And the case itself only takes around an hour to fully charge from zero.The charging case shows the percentage of its remaining charge in the centre, with animated battery icons either side, representing left and right earbuds. Initially I thought the battery icons would be illuminated according to the remaining charge of each earbud, but as soon as you insert the buds into the case, the battery icons light up in a sequential order from bottom to top in a continuous animation, even if your buds are 99% charged. When full, the battery icons remain solid. This was a little disappointing. Although my phone shows the power remaining for the earbuds when I connect to them, it would have been nicer if the case's battery icons reflected the earbuds remaining power, for example 2 solid bars for 50% etc.I like the way they auto connect to devices, such as my TV when I turn it on, or my phone when I enable Bluetooth. It sometimes doesn't happen though. In the case of my TV, if I turn it off to standby mode and back on, the earbuds will connect.The sound is good for watching TV, although a bit more clarity would be preferable. Once connected, my TV's EQ doesn't make a difference. But the buds are more than adequate for a late night noisy film viewing.Another aspect I really like is the triple tap to bring up your phone's voice assistant. I have smart plugs and lights in the home and have Alexa installed on my phone as the default assistant to control devices remotely. Tapping 3 times on either earbud opens up the dialogue for the voice assistant on my phone, doing the same thing as holding down the square home button on my phone's display, in my case it activates Alexa. So for one example I can get into bed, snuggle down with some cool tunes, and tap my earbud and tell Alexa to turn off the bedroom light.When you turn the buds on or off, and when they connect or disconnect, you hear a very loud female voice announcing the status. I find this a bit overly loud and wish that it could be turned down or disabled. When you are ready to listen to music and turn on the phones, you hear: POWER ON! PAIRING! And after connecting: CONNECTED!You can connect before you put the buds in your ear I guess, but then you can accidentally click to change the song or album etc. And if you fall asleep and lose your Bluetooth connection, or accidentally long press the bud as you lie on it, you will find yourself abruptly woken up with DISCONNECTED! POWER OFF! bellowing in your ear.Taps: tapping the earbuds provides the following actions:Single tap on left or right - pause/play.Long press on left - previous track.Long press on right - next track.Prolonged press on left or right - power off/on left or right earbud.Double tap on left - lower volume.Double tap on right - raise volume.Triple tap on left or right - activate your devices voice assistant.In summary: despite a couple of niggles, very good value for the price providing decent sound quality for casual music listening or film watching. With good battery life, speedy charging, very good Bluetooth range and voice assistant support is very welcome. Recommended for first time Bluetooth bud users or a cheap replacement for non audiophile listening.

Review - Body: I ordered them because of the good reviews and I didn't want to spend much on earpods, so they fitted the bill. Easy to use and sound is good (I'm not an expert and I use mine for audio as well as music) but I was a bit disappointed with the colour as the case of my rose gold version is not completely rose gold and has some white plastic side bids/panels which I find make them look a bit cheap/spoils the look. I know the sound is more important but it should look good too. It would have been better if all would have been pink as all the other colours have the case completely in the matching colour.  Hence only 4 stars from me. I ordered a white set too to decide at home which colour works better for me as it annoys me. I also find - because of the high side panels - they are a bit more fiddly to get out if you don't have long fingernails. But that's perhaps just me?! I returned mine as they always dropped out of my small ears.Otherwise excellent.

Product Title: Wireless Earbuds, Renimer Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones In Ear with ENC Mic, Wireless Headphones HiFi Stereo Deep Bass Mini Ear Buds, 48H Playtime LED Display Wireless Earphones, IP7 Waterproof/USB-C Black
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Impressive Earbuds That Exceed Expectations!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 September 2023
Review - Body: I recently got my hands on these earbuds, and I'm absolutely thrilled with my purchase. These little gems have surpassed my expectations in more ways than one. Here's why I'm giving them a glowing review:1. Outstanding Sound Quality:The sound quality on these earbuds is nothing short of exceptional. The bass is deep, the mids are clear, and the highs are crisp. Whether I'm listening to my favorite music, watching movies, or taking calls, the audio experience is top-notch.2. Comfortable Fit:These earbuds fit like a dream. They come with multiple ear tips, so you can find the perfect size for your ears. Once in place, they stay put, even during vigorous workouts. I can wear them for hours without any discomfort.3. Impressive Battery Life:The battery life on these earbuds is impressive. I can easily get through a full day of use without needing to recharge. The charging case provides extra juice, extending the playtime for long journeys.4. Reliable Connectivity:Pairing these earbuds with my devices is a breeze. Once connected, they maintain a stable and strong connection without dropouts. The Bluetooth range is also quite impressive.5. Noise Isolation:The passive noise isolation these earbuds provide is fantastic. It drowns out background noise effectively, allowing me to immerse myself in my music or podcasts, even in noisy environments.6. Touch Controls:The touch-sensitive controls are intuitive and responsive. I can easily play/pause music, adjust the volume, skip tracks, and even answer calls with a simple tap. It's incredibly convenient when I'm on the move.7. Durability and Build Quality:These earbuds feel solid and well-built. They've survived accidental drops and even a splash of water without any issues. I appreciate the attention to durability.8. Value for Money:Considering the performance and features, these earbuds are an absolute steal. You get premium sound quality and functionality without breaking the bank.9. Customer Service:I had a minor issue with one of the earbuds, and the customer service was quick to resolve it. Their responsiveness and willingness to help were commendable.In conclusion, these earbuds have been a game-changer in my audio experience. They offer superb sound quality, comfort, and convenience at an affordable price point. I wholeheartedly recommend them to anyone in need of high-quality wireless earbuds. You won't be disappointed!
Review - Format: Style Name: Bluetooth 5.3Colour Name: BlackVerified Purchase

Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 August 2023
Review - Body: Bought these to replace an older pair that I had misplaced. Initially just wanted for the gym as I wasn't expecting much for the price, however once receiving them I was amazed at the quality. Both the build quality and sound quality. I am since never without them.Often with cheaper priced earphones they hurt my ears after a short while. I recently wore these on a long flight and if it wasn't for the music, I wouldn't have known I was wearing them they are that comfortable.The sound was clear, with good bass levels too. Making videos especially immersive.The added feature of showing the battery levels on front means I never run low.Recommend these to anyone looking for quality sound at a fantastic price
Review - Format: Style Name: Bluetooth 5.3Colour Name: BlackVerified Purchase

    ¬†These are decent bluetooth ear buds. The sound is good, not amazing but for the price, they are definitely worth it.I find them comfortable to wear, and the battery life lasts just under 5 hours of constant use.Super easy to charge with a USB C cable, and you can use just one whilst the other is in the charging pod.The red pair came with 2 sets of ear buds, much better than only have one size to choose from,.The charging pod lights up when it's plugged in charging - but there isn't an indication of when the charging pod is out of battery.The earbuds themselves warn you when there is 10% left and they need charging so that's a plus.¬£19.99 at time of review.

Product Title: LEYUSMART Bluetooth Earbuds for iPhone 14 /Pro/iPhone 14 Pro Max/Plus/MacBook Pro/Air/Mac/iPad/Samsung/Android (Dad & Mum's GIFT for Teens) 3D HiFi Stereo in-Ear Charging Case Earphones White
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Definely value for money
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 September 2022
Review - Body: These earbuds are definely value for money.They are very compact and a good choice if you are looking for an acceptable sound at a good price.The outside of the buds fashion a little silver heart on each one and are reasonably comfortable once you have them in your ear right.They come in a nice box for presentation and are not packaged in the charging case itself but is packaged separately which when you open them gives them a nice presentation to look at.  They come with a nice, reasonably long charging cable but do NOT come with extra replacement earbuds of different sizes. The size that comes with them is all you get. For me I had to keep wiggling and pushing them in my ear because they didnt feel secure in my ear enough, but for someone else they may be perfect.They were easy to set up as you will see by the instructions, it took me seconds to get them working.The sounds on these are pretty clear and didnt hear no muffle or background hissing, they are not top quality sound but they are definitely a contender if you want good sound at a low price.I found that the controls for me were a little fiddly as they are on the stem which is running down the side of my ear, for me they would have been better on the top of earbud itself.  You can hear when you are controling them as you hear a little click with the tapping you do.Would I buy again? For me i probably wouldnt but for someone who likes good sound and hasnt much money then yes I would. These would definitely be good as a present for kids.
