Product Title: LEYUSMART Bluetooth Earbuds for iPhone 14 /Pro/iPhone 14 Pro Max/Plus/MacBook Pro/Air/Mac/iPad/Samsung/Android (Dad & Mum's GIFT for Teens) 3D HiFi Stereo in-Ear Charging Case Earphones White
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Easy set up and decent sound
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 October 2022
Review - Body: I got these as spare earbuds, but have ended up letting my Mum keep them as she tried them and loved them!These earbuds are easy to set up on a phone.  It took me a minute or so to set them up for my Mum and show her how to connect them if she needed to in future.  The buds are fairly decent sound, obviously not as good as other more expensive buds, but if you want a cheaper set to try or just something for occasional outdoor use (say doing the gardening like my Mum) then these are a good value option.  Fit is very comfortable and they stay in place really well.  Battery life also seems good and holds charge well.Recommended as a good budget set of earbuds that have good sound and feel comfortable.

Product Title: LEYUSMART Bluetooth Earbuds for iPhone 14 /Pro/iPhone 14 Pro Max/Plus/MacBook Pro/Air/Mac/iPad/Samsung/Android (Dad & Mum's GIFT for Teens) 3D HiFi Stereo in-Ear Charging Case Earphones White
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    A bit fiddly to use but great sound
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 September 2022
Review - Body: These were promptly delivered and were very well packaged. They worked straight out of the box and were easy to connect and use - to a point. Supplied instructions were straightforward.The sound to me through these is on par with slightly more expensive tethered bluetooth pairs I have had in the past. Trying most applications, i.e. music/podcasts and film, they sounded great for being averaged price buds. I had to adjust eq through my music app for best results in each application used aboveThe only downside for me was trying to skip tracks as it involves triple taps which I cannot seem to master while they are in my ear. They are sensitive enough to work but I assume that I am not holding them correctly when trying the different modes. This has always been problematic for me, even with tethered bluetooth pairs as I do not have the controls in front of me. One and two taps I can get the hang of. I don't think this a design fault, more user error.Although these are not your top end isolating earbuds, I was pleased with sound and will persevere with these. Worth a try if you are looking at something around the ¬£20-¬£30 mark.

Product Title: LEYUSMART Bluetooth Earbuds for iPhone 14 /Pro/iPhone 14 Pro Max/Plus/MacBook Pro/Air/Mac/iPad/Samsung/Android (Dad & Mum's GIFT for Teens) 3D HiFi Stereo in-Ear Charging Case Earphones White
Review - Title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    It's okay but controls don't work
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 September 2022
Review - Body: The headphones come in a white plastic charging case. Nothing really to say about the case. It's just functional but looks ok. There are no markings apart from a small LED light to indicate charge status. The light will be orange when charging and green when it's full.The headphones look ok, quite basic and flimsy plastic white with some silver edgings. The headphones are budget so you can't expect too much. Again they look okay. Nothing special but nothing bad either. They are perfectly fine. I would have no problem being out and about with these in... In any case, it's not like people are going to be looking too closely at your ears!The sound is loud which is a plus for me. There's no base, which does not bother me, but some might be bothered by this. I am no audiophile so for me the sound was loud and clear.There are some problems with the headphones. I had the same problems as quite a few other reviewers. The controls don't work at all. Additionally the headphones and case seem very flimsy and plasticy. I am not sure how long they would last. However these are very cheap for wireless headphones so if the lack of controls don't bother you and you just want some clear loud headphones then you could consider giving these a try.

Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Very compact!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 September 2022
Review - Body: Ok so I ordered these because the seem to be good value and have a small form factor.The are definitely nice and compact in its charging case and easy to travel around with.They were easy to set up and the sound quality was acceptable.not the best but definitely able to enjoy the music you love comfortably.Only thing I dislike is most of the pictures show the inside of the earbuds and not the outside stem part.The outside stem touch area has what looks like a mirror/metal look HEART which as a grown man I am really not a fan off at all which is such a shame.Aside from that I think the value for money is decent.just the hearts on the stem puts me off them.That is personal preference though and I could imagine there are a lot of people who would absolutely love it!If you don‚Äôt mind the heart I would recommend.

Product Title: LEYUSMART Bluetooth Earbuds for iPhone 14 /Pro/iPhone 14 Pro Max/Plus/MacBook Pro/Air/Mac/iPad/Samsung/Android (Dad & Mum's GIFT for Teens) 3D HiFi Stereo in-Ear Charging Case Earphones White
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great pair of headphones üéß
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 October 2022
Review - Body: Given the price of these headphones, I did not expect the performance on these to be quite good üëåüèªI have only used Apple or Samsung airpods/buds and wanted to try out something different and I was quite impressed with these! Firstly these are affordable which is great and the colour is also quite nice and unique.The design is nice and compact and very lightweight tooüëçüèªthese headphones in itself are quite easy to set up and use. These pair easily to your phone via a good Bluetooth connection. The sound quality on this is quite decent and what you would expect for this price. Depending on the outside, there can be fuzz time to time but nothing major. The battery life is also good, gave about 34hrs and will last you for majority of the day.Used it for gym and running outside as I like to keep myself fit. Notice cancellation is alright, I have heard better but works good.Overall not a bad pair of headphones. Would recommend.

Product Title: LEYUSMART Bluetooth Earbuds for iPhone 14 /Pro/iPhone 14 Pro Max/Plus/MacBook Pro/Air/Mac/iPad/Samsung/Android (Dad & Mum's GIFT for Teens) 3D HiFi Stereo in-Ear Charging Case Earphones White
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great sound quality but...
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 September 2022
Review - Body: Read thoroughly üü¢ : These are so cute. Love how they look like, very posh!  When you open the case the earphones will tell you the power is now on... well the lady's voice is rough. HER sound quality bad. HOWEVER once they are connected to your phone and you listen to music OMG the quality is great!!! I've got no complaints about that and I'm very impressed with how powerful they are and how good they sound so that would have been a 5* on it own.However.... I've got a few reasons why not to leave a 5* review and I even debated if to leave a 3* instead of a 4*... ‚û°Ô∏è-They look very much like the Apple ones. I've never tried that brand however I find these ines rather uncomfortable in my ears. It might just be a matter of getting used to them as the ones I currently use are of a different shape-The box they come in is plain white. Makes me think of a sort of fake product? Like why does it not have branding in it or something?-The case is lovely and small however it's very small in my opinion and it doesn't have any sort of loop/hook or anything that I could attach a string to it or something to hang from my neck when I'm out and about so I hope I won't lose them anywhere!-the box contains the earphones and case,  a type C wire and the instructions. There are no extra buds in it and the ones that come with it are SMALL. So again, I find them rather uncomfortable to wear. I tried swapping them for other buds I already had but they were too big and wouldn't allow the case to close so had to change back to the ones provided which is a shame.-the instructions are very basic. I don't know what I was expecting to be honest but my previous ones were more detailed. However once I turned the bluetooth on on my phone they connected to it straight away so no problem with that.This is my honest opinion so it's up to you to weigh what youwant from new earphones. Yes I made all the above points BUT don't forget the first and probably most important point I made... the quality of the sound is actually GREAT and in my opinion makes them a great product to have! I'm keeping them and enjoying some good quality music üòé

Product Title: Apple Watch SE (2nd generation) (GPS, 40mm) Smart watch - Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band - Regular. Fitness & Sleep Tracker, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Water Resistant
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Absolutely superb
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 September 2023
Review - Body: The Apple Watch SE (2nd generation) in its Starlight Aluminium Case paired with the Starlight Sport Band is a testament to Apple's commitment to blending functionality with style. The watch's aesthetic is both sleek and modern, with the Starlight color giving it a unique and sophisticated touch that can easily transition from a workout session to a night out.Performance-wise, the 2nd generation SE doesn't disappoint. It offers a smooth user experience, with apps launching quickly and the touch response being as intuitive as one would expect from an Apple product. The GPS feature is accurate and reliable, making it a great companion for outdoor activities and workouts. The fitness tracking capabilities are commendable, offering a wide range of metrics that cater to both casual users and fitness enthusiasts.The display is bright and clear, making it easy to read even in direct sunlight. The raise-to-wake feature is quite responsive, and the haptic feedback provides a tactile experience that feels premium. The integration with the iPhone is seamless, and the ability to receive notifications, answer calls, and even respond to messages directly from the watch is incredibly convenient.However, the Apple Watch SE (2nd generation) is not without its shortcomings. While it offers a plethora of features, it lacks the always-on display, which is a feature present in some of the higher-end models. This means you'll need to raise your wrist or tap the screen to see the time or check notifications. Additionally, while the battery life is decent, lasting a full day on moderate use, it might require nightly charging for those who use it extensively throughout the day.The Apple Watch SE (2nd generation) is a solid mid-range offering from Apple. It encapsulates most of the essential features that users have come to love about the Apple Watch series, all while being presented in a stylish Starlight Aluminium Case. While it might not have all the bells and whistles of its pricier counterparts, it offers great value for its price point and is a worthy consideration for those looking to enter the Apple Watch ecosystem or upgrade from an older model.

Review - Title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    The dumbest ‚Äúsmart watch‚Äù
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 July 2023
Review - Body: I knew Apple smart watches had battery life issues when I bought it, so that doesn‚Äôt go into the score, but compromises Apple have made to even achieve that paltry battery life makes the Apple watch a fancy kids toy, or a super niche use case.- It doesn‚Äôt do continuous hart rate monitoring, or not at any useful frequency.- It starts monitoring heart rate when it ‚Äúdetects‚Äù you are working out or you tell it explicitly that you are working out.- It does not expose gps control, so you can‚Äôt fine tune battery consumption- It does not detect automatic sleep posture. So unless you tell via the health app, when you are going to sleep, it won‚Äôt count any other naps as sleep time. There isn‚Äôt even a way to tell it that you are going to take a nap (or I haven‚Äôt found it).The super niche use case is if you give it to an elder in the family for fall detection. Even then the battery life will make it very difficult for such a person to use it independently without carer help. So again, kinda moot. Yes as a regular cyclist if you get bumped off the road by a car, that might be a useful scenario but no idea if it is triggered then.The only reason to have it is if you don‚Äôt want to give your data to Google or the dark web‚Ä¶ (ahem I meant a certain company who got ransomwared recently)

Product Title: Apple Watch Series 8 (GPS 41mm) Smart watch - Midnight Aluminium Case with Midnight Sport Band - Regular. Fitness Tracker, Blood Oxygen & ECG Apps, Water Resistant
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    A subtle but smart upgrade for your wrist - Pros & Cons
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 July 2023
Review - Body: The Apple Watch Series 8 is the latest iteration of Apple's popular smartwatch, and while it doesn't look much different from the previous models, it packs some new features that make it worth considering. In this review, I'll go over the Series 8's pros and cons, as well as the reasons to buy or avoid it and give my final verdict.~~~ Pros ~~~1- Attractive new colours: The Apple Watch Series 8 comes in four new aluminium colours: blue, green, red, and starlight (a mix of silver and gold). These add some variety and personality to the watch, and you can also mix and match them with different bands and watch faces.2- Skin temperature reader for cycle and sleep tracking: The Series 8 has a new dual-sensor design that can measure your skin temperature while you sleep. This can help you track changes in your menstrual cycle, ovulation, and fertility, as well as detect signs of fever or illness. You can view your temperature trends in the Health app on your iPhone, and get alerts if your temperature is too high or low.3- Crash detection: It has improved motion sensors that can detect if you've been in a car crash, and automatically call emergency services and send your location to your emergency contacts. This can be a lifesaver in case you're unconscious or unable to reach your phone. You can also manually trigger this feature by pressing and holding the side button.4- New watchOS 9 workout interface: It runs on watchOS 9, which brings some enhancements to the workout app. You can now see more metrics on the screen, such as calories, heart rate, distance, pace, and time. You can also customize which metrics you want to see, and swipe left or right to switch between them. The workout app also supports new types of exercises, such as dance, functional strength training, and tai chi.5- Longer battery life with low power mode: It has a slightly larger battery than the Series 7, which gives it up to 18 hours of battery life on a single charge. However, if you want to extend it even further, you can use the new low-power mode, which turns off most features except for the time and notifications. This can give you up to 36 hours of battery life, which is useful for camping trips or long flights.~~~ Cons ~~~1- Battery life still lacking: While the low power mode is a nice addition, the Apple Watch still falls behind some of its competitors when it comes to battery life. For example, the Samsung Galaxy Watch 4 can last up to two days on a single charge, and the Fitbit Versa 3 can last up to six days. If you use features like GPS, cellular, music streaming, or always-on display, you'll need to charge your Apple Watch every day or even more often.2- Identical design to last year: The Series 8 has the same design and display as the Series 7, which means it doesn't look very different from the previous models. Some users might have hoped for a more radical redesign, such as a round or square shape, thinner bezels, or a larger screen. The Apple Watch Ultra offers some of these changes, but it's also much more expensive and not widely available.3- Wish it borrowed the Apple Watch Ultra's siren: The Apple Watch Ultra has a unique feature that lets you activate a loud siren from your wrist in case of danger or distress. This can be useful for scaring off attackers or attracting attention from bystanders. The Apple Watch doesn't have this feature, which seems like a missed opportunity for enhancing its safety capabilities.~~~ Reasons to buy~~~- If you want a smartwatch that works seamlessly with your iPhone and other Apple devices- If you care about tracking your health and fitness metrics, especially your skin temperature- If you value having safety features like crash detection and emergency SOS on your wrist- If you like having access to a wide range of apps, watch faces, and bands for customization- If you don't mind charging your watch every day or using low-power mode~~~Reasons to avoid~~~- If you want a smartwatch that has longer battery life or faster charging- If you want a smartwatch that has a different design or display from the previous models- If you want a smartwatch that has more advanced features like blood pressure monitoring or siren- If you don't use an iPhone or other Apple devices- If you find the price too high or prefer a cheaper alternative~~~ Conclusion ~~~The Apple Watch Series 8 is a minor but significant improvement over the Series 7. It now includes new features that improve its health and safety capabilities, such as a skin temperature reader and crash detection. It also runs on watchOS 9, which improves the workout app as well as the battery life. It does not, however, change much in terms of design or display, and it continues to lag behind some of its competitors in terms of battery life and innovation. The Apple Watch Series 8 is an excellent choice if you want a smartwatch that works well with your iPhone and has a comprehensive set of features. However, if you want something more unique or more affordable, you should look elsewhere.

    ¬†Yes, it‚Äôs very expensive.Yes, Apple own too much of my life.But yes, it makes my life so much simple.As a neurodivergent parent with other roles and responsibilities, having my reminders and appointments right on my wrist helps my busy brain to cope with daily life.Seeing notifications and being able to decide whether I need to deal with them straight away without checking my phone (and getting distracted by every other app I see and forgetting to deal with the initial notification) makes me much more productive.My previous smart watch had fewer features but didn‚Äôt work the way I had wanted - I really wanted the organisational assistance of an Apple Watch but without the distractions the many features would provide. This is an absolute blessing for someone whose brain hates instruction manuals and setup.The only downside I‚Äôve really come across is the battery life, which is roughly a day. I don‚Äôt mind because I just have the charger next to my bed and charge it while I read, then it‚Äôs full when I go to bed and then in the morning I can see how badly I‚Äôve slept.Also it‚Äôs really pretty. See how pretty it is? So pretty.

Product Title: Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 41mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminum Case with Starlight Sport Loop One Size. Fitness Tracker, Blood Oxygen & ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Minor evolution over Series 7 & 8, but big improvements for those upgrading from older versions
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 October 2023
Review - Body: How often do you upgrade your smart devices? I upgrade my iPhone every 2-3 generations, the same goes for my iPad Pro. But what about the Apple Watch? I don‚Äôt believe the majority of people upgrade every year, or even two or three years. The incremental improvements to each generation of Apple Watch appears so minor that you‚Äôd struggle to see the difference if two successive devices were compared against each other.Which is why I‚Äôve waited so long to upgrade from my pensionable Series 3. I‚Äôve had it since shortly after its release at the end of 2017. 6 years is a long time for a gadget, especially one that is attached to my body every single day. But I‚Äôve struggled to see the reason for upgrading, despite my Series 3 become less and less reliable over the passing years. The screen was sometimes washing out and made it difficult to read, especially outdoors. The finger gestures to swipe up and down rarely worked, and the crown dial was almost fused to the watch it was that difficult to move. The heart beat monitor was sporadic at best, and it was pure fluke that it ever recorded any meaningful data from a workout. Yet, still I wore it. Mainly because as well as telling the time, the haptics were brilliant and a more reliable way of knowing when a message or call was coming in than my phone which I have on silent and regularly put down and forget I‚Äôve left it behind.I‚Äôd been waiting for a big development of the Apple Watch to tempt me into buying a new one. Every new generation improved all of the health tracking functions a little bit at a time, occasionally adding new things like sleep tracking. What I was really hoping for was a blood pressure monitor, something that Apple have submitted patents for but it still hasn‚Äôt made its way to the Watch yet. As someone who has migraines from an early age, I‚Äôve found that a migraine attack often coincides with a spike in blood pressure so a means of tracking this might help in anticipating the next attack. It looks like I need to wait a little longer though for that functionality.Despite this still not appearing, I felt that Series 9 was the time to finally upgrade. The vast majority of this generations improvements are subtle. It‚Äôs got a new processor that is faster than the previous one, which is great but honestly how often to you notice the step up in performance? Especially on a watch that isn‚Äôt going to be doing a lot of heavy lifting processor wise. The screen is twice as bright as the previous generation, going up to 2,000 nits. I‚Äôve certainly noticed that the screen is easy to read even in bright sunshine, at least compared to my Series 3 anyway. It also goes down to a very low 1 nit brightness, which is useful if you wear your watch to bed as a sleep tracker.There‚Äôs an improved Ultra-wideband chip which helps finding your other apple devices such as phones, earphones and smart trackers. Siri no longer needs the word ‚Äúhey‚Äù adding before it‚Äôll wake up to your requests. But, generally, there aren‚Äôt many ground breaking improvements.The battery life is still as unremarkable as ever. Compared to most other smart watches the Apple Watch has always been pretty poor. Long-time users will be well used to this, and will have developed their own way of managing the battery, but new users may be disappointed or shocked at the battery life on an Apple Watch. Apple always claim an ‚Äúall day‚Äù 18 hour battery life, and in fairness is based on plenty of use during the day, but it‚Äôs still less than impressive. The obvious way to manage your battery is to charge it every night. Take it off your wrist, put it on a bedside charger and it‚Äôll be good to go when you wake up in the morning. But, what if you want to use it as a sleep tracker. The Apple Watch is actually really good for use as a sleep tracker, and gives you a lot of interesting data about your sleep patterns‚Ä¶but when do you charge it? I personally take it off my wrist for a quick charge when I get into bed at night as I‚Äôm usually still on my iPad or reading a book for at least half an hour. Then I put it back on again when I go to sleep. From 100% at midnight the Series 9 has been around the 30-40% mark come 11pm. That includes around 7 hours as a sleep tracker, general day use and 30 minutes on the treadmill and walking the dog. Note that for the last few generations the Apple Watch now has a permanently on screen, so you don‚Äôt need to lift your arm to activate the screen.There is one big improvement for the Apple Watch Series 9 though. Double Tap. This was demonstrated in the Apple launch show in September, and is a means of controlling certain functions on whatever the current live app is by tapping your thumb and index finger on your watch hand together. If a call is coming in, tap your thumb and finger to answer it. If an alarm is going off, tap your thumb and finger together to silence it. This means you‚Äôre able to interact with your Watch without your other hand. That might sound a bit daft, but in practice I can imagine that being really useful. I use timers a lot in the kitchen and I‚Äôve often got greasy or floury hands when a timer goes off, so this could well be a useful function I use a lot. I say could, because at the time of writing Apple haven‚Äôt activated it. It‚Äôs apparently going to be available in a software update in October.There are an awful lot of options for buying an Apple Watch Series 9. It comes in two standard sizes, 41mm and 45mm, and is available in GPS only or GPS + cellular form. There is the Ultra 2 as well, which is only GPS + cellular and is 49mm. You‚Äôve then also got a huge array of colours and straps to choose from. I went with the 45mm GPS only version, which I would imagine will be the most common option. There‚Äôs ¬£30 difference in the RRP of the 41mm and 45mm, and the extra screen size is more than worth it. My Series 3 was 42mm, and despite only an extra 3mm increase the Series 9 fits so much more on its screen that the Series 3. It makes such a big difference so I would recommend the larger size. Regarding whether you need cellular, this will be down to what you‚Äôll use it for. My Series 3 was cellular, and for the first few years I paid for a separate contract with EE which started at ¬£5 per month but gradually got more and more expensive. It was nice to be able to leave my phone behind on workouts, but when COVID landed and our lifestyles changed I found that I no longer needed the Watch to be cellular, and cancelled my EE contract. I can genuinely say I haven‚Äôt noticed. The occasions when I might not have my phone with me are so rare that it just wasn‚Äôt worth the extra cost of buying the Watch and then the ongoing sim contract.Set up of the watch was as straight-forward as Apple products usually are. I‚Äôd backed up my Series 3 and when I turned on the 9 it gave me the option to install from my backup. I said yes and everything came over automatically. The only thing I needed to do was add the 3-digit code from my payments cards to Apple Pay. If you‚Äôre new to Apple Watch, do remember that it is still dependant on having an iPhone. An iPhone continues to be the life support for Apple Watch.So, is the Apple Watch Series 9 right for you? Given the very minor improvements over the previous two generations, I would say that there‚Äôs little reason to upgrade from a Series 7 or 8. However, earlier generations will see a marked improvement over their current watches. I debated for a long time whether to finally go for it, but the difference over my Series 3 is significant. Most things still look the same, but they work more reliably and efficiently. The brightness of the screen is noticeable. I‚Äôve got more information on my home screen than I had previously. The extra size of the screen is barely noticeable on my wrist.For me, I feel justified in my purchase of the Series 9. Even with the 6 year gap, there isn‚Äôt a huge difference, but it‚Äôs enough for me to be satisfied I‚Äôve made the right decision. I wish Apple could sort out the battery life, and one day a blood pressure monitor will be great, but until then the Series 9 is the new benchmark for smart watches.

Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 September 2023
Review - Body: At first I was a bit sceptical about this watch as it wasn‚Äôt over priced and it had ¬£6.00 discount off at checkout. I have been pleasantly surprised by what a great little gadget it is. Once I‚Äôd got it all set up and linked to my phone, it has surpassed my expectations. I realised that I needed to have a slightly different Bluetooth setup to answer calls, it was driving me mad as to why I could receive but not answer or make calls, so once I‚Äôd overcome this, I felt much happier with the purchase. It measures my bpm, stress levels, alerts me of phone calls, facility to set an alarm, counts my steps, and can link in with gym activities and more facilities. It will also link in with my Spotify, I can skip songs from my watch that I‚Äôm not fussed about. I can make and receive calls. You can change the clock to a number of designs, and also pay for some if you want to, but personally I‚Äôm happy with the free choices. I chose the purple strap, as 1) it‚Äôs my favourite colour and 2) I thought it would probably wear better against sweat and day to day wear and tear. All in all I‚Äôm chuffed with my purchase that I treat myself to out of some birthday money.

Product Title: Smart Watch for Women(Answer/Make Call), Alexa Built-in 1.7" Touch Screen Fitness Watch with SpO2 Heart Rate Sleep Monitor, 60 Sports, IP68 Waterproof Step Counter Ladies Smartwatch for iPhone Android
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Overall, I couldn't be much happier with this purchase.
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 June 2023
Review - Body: I have to say this watch is good, and reasonably price for all the useful features built into it.  While there are a couple of additional features that would have made this an exceptional product at this price point, you have to accept you are not paying anywhere near what the top end smart watches demand, which makes this a very good purchase. One of the things I really like about this watch is that that it is not just a sports watch, although there is the option to select 24 sports modes from a list of more in the app for those who need exercise tracking.It has the standard health tracking such as steps and distance (which can be set in miles or km), heart rate, Blood oxygen, Stress monitoring, sleep monitoring.  Unfortunately, there is no blood pressure measurement, which might have been useful.It also has some other really cool features, firstly you can make and receive calls on the watch using the built in speaker and mic (which works well, judging from the fact the people at the other end didn't know I was calling from the watch).  There is even an option to set up a number of contact in the app (and therefore on the watch so you don't have to remember frequently used numbers.  I have not been able to make/answer calls on the watch while using hands free earbuds/headphones, it seems to default to the watch unless you make/answer calls on the phone, but that could just be I haven't worked it out yet.Alexa built in, this is one of the reasons I bought this watch, and like all Alexa devices it is great when it works.  As we all know, sometimes talking to Alexa devises can be like getting a naughty 5yr old to do what you want, and occasionally that applies here.  You can request information, control smart home devices such as light bulbs, although it tends to take a little longer to complete the request than some devices.  Its really easy to sign into you amazon account and start using Alexa, takes less than a minute.  Which is a good thing because you will need to log back in every few days, even if you check stay logged in.Other useful features include noise monitoring, which is definitely useful if your unfortunate enough to have noisy neighbours for example.  Music Control on yr phone, which removes the need to get the phone out to change tracks or the volume level, etc.  There is also a Find my phone/watch option if you forget where you left one of them. It even has a Flash light built in, which I thought was a bit gimmicky, but find that I do use it. I am not going to mention time/weather other than to say, its a watch and has what you would expect.  There is a choice of multiple dials, several of which can be downloaded onto the watch, what is different is you have a choice of 3 custom dials.One thing that is a little disappointing to me personally is that the Watch will receive notifications from SMS, Calendar and some social media apps, but the options here are limited.  I would have liked to have seen smart home apps included for set up within the app, so that security device notifications will vibrate on your wrist.  This is something I have seen on some very cheap, allegedly (but not particularly) smart watches. Maybe this will be addressed in future app updates.The final point I want to make is that I have seen some negative comments about Tensky Customer Services, I personally has found them to be very helpful, providing very good after sales support.  I can only think of two other companies that offer this kind of customer support.Overall, I couldn't be much happier with this purchase.

Product Title: Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones with 4 ENC Mic, 2023 Wireless Headphones In Ear 40H Deep Bass Bluetooth Earphones with Noise Cancelling, IP7 Waterproof Bluetooth Earbuds, LED Display/USB-C
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Decent set of earbuds the I13 wireless Ordtop head phones 5.3
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 July 2023
Review - Body: My new phone meant I needed new earbuds as more phones are coming without a wired connection. I was pleasantly surprised at the clarity of sound on phone calls using these new ‚Äòwireless‚Äô earbuds. I‚Äôve checked how my voice sounds with my callers, and I‚Äôm told it‚Äôs just as good. The instructions with the Ordtop I13 True wireless earbuds were also easy to follow. And they come with a different size selection of earbud silicone tips, which gave me options to find which fits my ear best.And once Bluetooth (5.3 techs) is connected, an LED light shows how much power is left in the charging case when taking the buds out. It means the earbuds come out of the case fully charged. After a week, I haven‚Äôt had to recharge the case! I guess this depends on how many hours one uses the buds. But based on my experience, I‚Äôm impressed as it seems to support the claim of a 40-hour playback time.The big test was playing music on my phone as I was used to my old Apple wired earbuds (which had good base notes and high range) on an Android.I wasn‚Äôt disappointed with these earbuds (especially considering the price difference!) I find the playback sound of my favourite tracks to be excellent. I used them outside, in the wind and rain, and the noise cancellation was just as effective.I agree that the sound is immersive and rich, with a deep base and good high-tone quality as a default setting. There is no way to alter these settings, if you are seeking this, you need to look at a higher price point, but I am delighted with the integrated settings on the Ordtop I13 true wireless earbuds.All in all, a good buy.

Product Title: Beats Studio Buds ‚Äì True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds ‚Äì IPX4 rating, Sweat Resistant Earphones, Compatible with Apple & Android, Class 1 Bluetooth, Built-in Microphone ‚Äì White
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Hands down the best ear buds I have owned!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 September 2023
Review - Body: I want to start off by saying that when it comes to headphones/ear buds I am a bit of a snob. You really do get what you pay for when it comes to earbuds. I currently own some JBL by and some Sennheiser ones, with the Sennheiser costing me almost ¬£200. I like to listen to a lot of music and so I like it to sound top quality. One of my earbuds keeps losing connetion with Bluetooth so they are on their way out hence me wanting a new pair!I decided to give these a try based on reviews both on Amazon and other websites.This is my first ever Beats purchase and was apprehensive as I've heard some negative things about Beats headphones either not being worth the money or that a ¬£10 pair work better.Anyway, I absolutely love these!! I bought the pink ones and I look I've how they look. The case is also a much better shape than most as it is narrow and could be carried in your pocket more or less unoticed. They are also great for cancelling out loud noises if you have no music or whatever playing. Although you can still hear, the reduce the noise so much and so I think they would be an excellent choice for someone with sensory issues. As soon as I opened the case, a message popped up on my iPhone just like it does when you first connect an iPad or watch etc. It was just so simple to pair them!Inside the box are instructions, some smaller and larger tips and also a small wire which as a usb-c to -usb-c meaning you can use your usb-c to lightening cable plug which comes with the iPhones 11 and up. Each earbud has a physical button to press to end call, switch music etc. I much prefer this to my other tap to touch earbuds as it doesn't always register the first tap and you also you are far less likely to accidentaly nudge them.Right onto the most important aspect - the sound. I am really impressed by these. They sound quite a lot better than my Sennheiser ones. Sennheiser have always had a reputation for being one of the best on the market and so to think these are better just shows you they are worth the money! I can actually hear bits in songs that I have never heard before at all, such as backing harmonies or certain instruments. Some headphones/earbuds and known to sound better for some genres of music than others. For example, Sennheiser are known to give any rock/metal a really good sound. As a rock and metal fan, I can honestly say that these have made some of my favourite songs sound even better.I think a lot of people buy Beats for the name or trend purposes and if that's the case then at least paying for the name provides some excellent quality earbuds.Lastly, another feature I like is that you can check the battery percentage for each airbud individually - thus meaning you will get twice  the battery life if you listen to anything with just one earbuds in. I think that's a cool little touch. I really do recommend these. (P.s. Thats my honest and genuine opinion, I haven't been asked to leave a good review in exchange for anything - just thought I'd throw that out there!

Product Title: Beats Studio Buds ‚Äì True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds ‚Äì IPX4 rating, Sweat Resistant Earphones, Compatible with Apple & Android, Class 1 Bluetooth, Built-in Microphone ‚Äì White
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    A lot of bang for the buck!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 September 2023
Review - Body: I highly recommend these. I got them on sale from amazon warehouse during the last prime days and I can only compare them against other three earbuds I've owned as an iPhone user:1. Sony WF-1000XM3: compared to the Sony's the Beats are waaay better, better noise cancellation, better sound, more comfortable and better integration with iPhone. Transparency mode is way better on the Beats.2. Jabra Elite 75t‚Äã, there's no comparison. The Jabra where the first earbuds I owned and I returned them after a week. Noise cancellation is weak, they are more comfortable than the Sony's but sound quality sucks.3. Apple Airpods Pro: these are the best earbuds I used. Noise cancellation is a notch better than the beats, transparency mode is the best across the board, better than the beats. Sounds quality is a notch better than the beats but not my much. These are THE MOST comfortable earbuds out there, you barely notice them on your ears. These have the best integration with any apple product.Today, I'm a happy user of the Beats... you might wonder why? Well, they cost me 1/4 of the Airpods Pro and I get 80-90% of the value. I can't really afford paying ¬£250 for earbuds but I can afford paying ¬£60. These are really good.

Product Title: Beats Studio Buds ‚Äì True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds ‚Äì IPX4 rating, Sweat Resistant Earphones, Compatible with Apple & Android, Class 1 Bluetooth, Built-in Microphone ‚Äì White
Review - Title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Pretty good for the price but some compromises
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 April 2022
Review - Body: I have been using the Beats Studio Buds for over a month now, and I can say that it‚Äôs a pretty solid experience but there are some very frustrating issues that impact the experience.They are considered  to be a cheaper alternative to AirPods and they are a good bang for your buck, generally speaking.Going for these rather than the AirPods does saves you about ¬£140 for very solid quality however, you should be aware of the what you will compromise for that nice price tag.Let‚Äôs start with the good things:1. Sound quality. It‚Äôs very good for ¬£110. For most users, I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs more than enough. Perhaps audiophiles will not be satisfied but nonetheless, this is not one of its major issues.2. Noise cancellation. It‚Äôs not bad at all. Not as good as the AirPods‚Äô but you will not hear anything with it turned on as long as music is playing as well, so solid.This is where these earbuds suffer:3. Design. The earbuds will probably struggle to stay in your ear. You might be able to get them in good, but if you are a bit sweaty or you have some earwax, they will start to slip and you‚Äôll have to push them in.Additionally, this creates another major issue. The play/pause button placement on the two earbuds are a very bad design. Every time the earbud slips out, you‚Äôll have to push it back in, and you‚Äôre most likely going to press the button and pause the music. You might be able to avoid this by pinching the earbuds and pushing them in that way, but you still might press it down because the button overlaps the edges.This has become incredibly frustrating as time has gone on, and it has made me consider getting new headphones just because of this.4. Battery life. It‚Äôs actually pretty good. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs close to what is advertised but it has been a major issue for me personally. However, the issue with the battery is that, in order to connect your earbuds, it is reliant on the case having some charge. If your case is dead but the earbuds are not, you cannot connect them through Bluetooth.It is honestly ridiculous that you can‚Äôt use the earbuds in that case because you might have another few hours of charge from the earbuds themselves but you cant use them! It‚Äôs crazy because my first generation AirPods connected fine when the case was dead, as long as the AirPods themselves had charge. I don‚Äôt understand why it needs the case to connect, cant the earbuds themselves have Bluetooth chips? I guess they don‚Äôt, so it‚Äôs a bad design. It‚Äôs not something that would deter me personally from the using the device entirely as it takes a few days before the case runs out of charge, but if you don‚Äôt notice the case reaching 0% you will no longer be able to listen to your music.Overall, the Beats Studio Buds are not a bad purchase. If you aren‚Äôt looking to spend ¬£250 on AirPods Pros right now, this is a very good option for a cheaper alternative, but I would not recommend this as anything other than temporary or as secondary headphones as there are some pretty major drawbacks that unfortunately ruin what is otherwise a really good experience when it comes to actually listening to the music.

Product Title: Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Mini Wireless Headphones In Ear with ENC Noise Cancelling Mic, 42H Bluetooth Earbuds with HiFi Stereo Bluetooth Earphones IP7 Waterproof, LED Display
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great sound quality, comfortable, long battery life
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 September 2023
Review - Body: I love the sound quality of these, which are excellent.  They are also comfortable to wear for long periods and don't fall out easily at all.  The battery life is particularly impressive and I'm amazed at how long they last on a single charge!  The only downsides are the touch controls (which I find annoying rather than helpful - but you do learn to not touch the bottom parts of them after a while), the voice that says "pairing", "connected" and "disconnected" is a bit too loud (just remember not to have them in your ears while pairing or connecting/disconnecting them!).  And in my experience, the audio lag is noticeable when watching any form of TV or video.  To be fair I haven't tried it on a very recent device, but on Samsung TV (AU7100 with Bluetooth 4.2), PC with Bluetooth dongle (v5.3), and my work laptop (a few years old now - can't tell which Bluetooth version it supports) there's always a bit of a lag.  Whether this is the earphones or the source devices I can't say for sure, but it does mean I don't use these for watching TV or video and save them for listening to music around the house, for which they are truly excellent!

I mainly use them to listen to audio books. I had to turn the volume down with my phone volume buttons.

Product Title: Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Mini Wireless Headphones In Ear with ENC Noise Cancelling Mic, 42H Bluetooth Earbuds with HiFi Stereo Bluetooth Earphones IP7 Waterproof, LED Display
Review - Title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Some issues and lacking in some areas. (Review of a Music Technician)
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 March 2023
Review - Body: Before starting this review I‚Äôd just like to say that experiences might differ from person to person. This is from your own testing and interpretation over the past week.Being a Music Technician I spend a lot of time with headphones, earphones, speakers and almost any type of audio equipment you can think of. Over time I‚Äôve developed a good ear for quality or inconsistencies that other might not hear themselves.Using this particular pair of earphones I can tell you in all honesty I didn‚Äôt get them because I thought they‚Äôd be good, I got them as more of quick use wireless earphones for things like the gym. They have been great for things like that, they have maintained they‚Äôre connection through every use and also sound pretty good at medium volume. Issues start to arise when you really listen to them or increase you volume.Something I‚Äôve noticed with this particular pair I‚Äôve received is that at loud volumes there is this sound that can only be described as ‚Äúthe bass being underwater‚Äù. It only seems to happen when the volume is at full or close to full but it is extremely noticeable and I find myself not putting them at max volume a lot of the time. (You shouldn‚Äôt do that anyway, but it‚Äôs worth mentioning).Something else I‚Äôve noticed is that these earphones are apparently supposed to have some kind of ‚Äúnoise cancellation‚Äù which I have barely noticed any such kind of feature. If there is noise cancellation it is very faint and I‚Äôm still unsure if it even has noise cancellation.Something else I‚Äôd like to comment on is how these compare to other wireless earphones of a similar price. There is a lot of different brands out there to use. Most people choose Apples AirPods and rightly so, they are a quality pair of wireless earphones that only really brought down by their price. These wireless earphones I feel are incorrectly priced, I get them discounted from their normal price yet I still felt that even if I had bought them at their normal price they wouldn‚Äôt be worth it. For example Google‚Äôs earbuds with are roughly ¬£20 more are leagues better than these and will definitely stand the test of time. Yet after a week with these I have noticed multiple issues. Sound at low and mid ranges are actually pretty good, but again the bass can feel weak and has issues when turned up to full volume.Some good points I‚Äôd like to note on, cause are there are some, is the battery life and feel of the product. The battery took multiple days before they ran out of charge on the case, the EarPods in of themselves can run out within roughly 4-5 hours of constant use which is expected. Thanks to the battery life of the case however, this is more than made up for. I‚Äôve found the battery life of the case will last close to a week keeping the EarPods charged.The quality of feel and aesthetic is something worth noting on, although they might not be a sleek at AirPods they are good for what they are. Everything has a good weight and look and feels somewhere in between quality and cheap feeling. The actual lid of the case is probably the cheapest feeling part of the whole product and just feels lighter than everything else, the snap from closing the case feels more cheap because of it. Unfortunately.Overall, I‚Äôll say these earphones did their job. They‚Äôve been useful for the gym, commuting and regular usage. They lack in many areas however and I‚Äôd only recommend them if they were discounted because I don‚Äôt feel like they are worth their actual price. Keeping in mind it is possible I have received a faulty pair in terms of the under water sounding bass, the sound is decent and honestly does the job. If you are wondering what to do I‚Äôd say have more of a look around at other earbuds before trying these, and if you are trying these really spend some time with them to see if your problems are similar to mine and from there request a replacement or refund.

    ¬†These are decent bluetooth ear buds. The sound is good, not amazing but for the price, they are definitely worth it.I find them comfortable to wear, and the battery life lasts just under 5 hours of constant use.Super easy to charge with a USB C cable, and you can use just one whilst the other is in the charging pod.The red pair came with 2 sets of ear buds, much better than only have one size to choose from,.The charging pod lights up when it's plugged in charging - but there isn't an indication of when the charging pod is out of battery.The earbuds themselves warn you when there is 10% left and they need charging so that's a plus.¬£19.99 at time of review.

    ¬†I‚Äôve used many headphones in my time and these are definitely worth the money if ur not using them 24/7 non stop.  Using them for 4-5 hours  you will start to notice u occasionally have to re adjust them in ur ears as the comfort level isn‚Äôt the best.  Although it‚Äôs lacking features such as base boost and vocal boost you still have a good quality sound and if you have on 70-100% volume level  you won‚Äôt be hearing anything else around you they are easy to set up and use  and once u disconnect it will automatically reconnect to ur device once open the slick black appearance is nice tho scratches will show. The battery life for me was about 12 hours at 70% volume.

    ¬†These are decent bluetooth ear buds. The sound is good, not amazing but for the price, they are definitely worth it.I find them comfortable to wear, and the battery life lasts just under 5 hours of constant use.Super easy to charge with a USB C cable, and you can use just one whilst the other is in the charging pod.The red pair came with 2 sets of ear buds, much better than only have one size to choose from,.The charging pod lights up when it's plugged in charging - but there isn't an indication of when the charging pod is out of battery.The earbuds themselves warn you when there is 10% left and they need charging so that's a plus.¬£19.99 at time of review.

    ¬†I‚Äôve used many headphones in my time and these are definitely worth the money if ur not using them 24/7 non stop.  Using them for 4-5 hours  you will start to notice u occasionally have to re adjust them in ur ears as the comfort level isn‚Äôt the best.  Although it‚Äôs lacking features such as base boost and vocal boost you still have a good quality sound and if you have on 70-100% volume level  you won‚Äôt be hearing anything else around you they are easy to set up and use  and once u disconnect it will automatically reconnect to ur device once open the slick black appearance is nice tho scratches will show. The battery life for me was about 12 hours at 70% volume.

Product Title: STUDIO NOD Wireless Earbuds with Premium Metal Design, Wireless Earphones with wearing detection, Built-in Microphone, Bass tube, 13mm titanium driver, Tap control, USB-C charging
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Pleasantly surprised
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 November 2022
Review - Body: I was pleasantly surprised by the audio quality and the quality of the mic.Pros:- Audio quality is superb- Mic sensor is surprisingly good! I feel it picks up sound even better than my dedicated USB condenser mic!- Pairing with different devices was very easy - I tried pairing and unpairing with various devices, and the process was very easy (I had a pair of Anker wireless earphones and I am scared to unpair them because it was too fiddly to re-pair!)Cons:- Maybe the material of the casing isn't to my liking. I would personally have preferred plastic than aluminium. However, having said that, the case is very lightweight- The supplied USB cable is not the most premium I have seen. But it does the job.Overall, compared to the Apple Airpods, its a bargain!

Review - Body: I have been using these headphones for a few weeks. The Bluetooth connectivity is very stable. It's so easy to re-connect, and switch between single-ear-mode and twin-ear-mode. I think I only recharged the case once in weeks.

    ¬†These are decent bluetooth ear buds. The sound is good, not amazing but for the price, they are definitely worth it.I find them comfortable to wear, and the battery life lasts just under 5 hours of constant use.Super easy to charge with a USB C cable, and you can use just one whilst the other is in the charging pod.The red pair came with 2 sets of ear buds, much better than only have one size to choose from,.The charging pod lights up when it's plugged in charging - but there isn't an indication of when the charging pod is out of battery.The earbuds themselves warn you when there is 10% left and they need charging so that's a plus.¬£19.99 at time of review.

    ¬†I‚Äôve used many headphones in my time and these are definitely worth the money if ur not using them 24/7 non stop.  Using them for 4-5 hours  you will start to notice u occasionally have to re adjust them in ur ears as the comfort level isn‚Äôt the best.  Although it‚Äôs lacking features such as base boost and vocal boost you still have a good quality sound and if you have on 70-100% volume level  you won‚Äôt be hearing anything else around you they are easy to set up and use  and once u disconnect it will automatically reconnect to ur device once open the slick black appearance is nice tho scratches will show. The battery life for me was about 12 hours at 70% volume.

    ¬†I‚Äôve used many headphones in my time and these are definitely worth the money if ur not using them 24/7 non stop.  Using them for 4-5 hours  you will start to notice u occasionally have to re adjust them in ur ears as the comfort level isn‚Äôt the best.  Although it‚Äôs lacking features such as base boost and vocal boost you still have a good quality sound and if you have on 70-100% volume level  you won‚Äôt be hearing anything else around you they are easy to set up and use  and once u disconnect it will automatically reconnect to ur device once open the slick black appearance is nice tho scratches will show. The battery life for me was about 12 hours at 70% volume.

    ¬†I‚Äôve used many headphones in my time and these are definitely worth the money if ur not using them 24/7 non stop.  Using them for 4-5 hours  you will start to notice u occasionally have to re adjust them in ur ears as the comfort level isn‚Äôt the best.  Although it‚Äôs lacking features such as base boost and vocal boost you still have a good quality sound and if you have on 70-100% volume level  you won‚Äôt be hearing anything else around you they are easy to set up and use  and once u disconnect it will automatically reconnect to ur device once open the slick black appearance is nice tho scratches will show. The battery life for me was about 12 hours at 70% volume.
